toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Endpoint do
  use Phoenix.Endpoint, otp_app: :cryptobox_phoenix

  # The session will be stored in the cookie and signed,
  # this means its contents can be read but not tampered with.
  # Set :encryption_salt if you would also like to encrypt it.
  @session_options [
    store: :cookie,
    key: "_cryptobox_phoenix_key",
    signing_salt: "e4QF3kZZ",
    same_site: "Lax"
  ]

  # socket "/live", Phoenix.LiveView.Socket,
  #   websocket: [connect_info: [session: @session_options]],
  #   longpoll: [connect_info: [session: @session_options]]

  # Serve at "/" the static files from "priv/static" directory.
  #
  # You should set gzip to true if you are running phx.digest
  # when deploying your static files in production.
  plug Plug.Static,
    at: "/",
    from: :cryptobox_phoenix,
    gzip: false,
    only: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.static_paths()

  # Code reloading can be explicitly enabled under the
  # :code_reloader configuration of your endpoint.
  if code_reloading? do
    plug Phoenix.CodeReloader
  end

  plug Plug.RequestId
  plug Plug.Telemetry, event_prefix: [:phoenix, :endpoint]

  plug Plug.Parsers,
    parsers: [:urlencoded, :multipart, :json],
    pass: ["*/*"],
    json_decoder: Phoenix.json_library()

  plug Plug.MethodOverride
  plug Plug.Head
  plug Plug.Session, @session_options
  plug CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Router
end

  channel "terminal:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.TerminalChannel
  channel "resources:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.ResourcesChannel
  channel "ai_tasks:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.AITasksChannel

  def connect(params, socket, _connect_info) do
    # For now, accept all connections
    # In production, implement proper authentication
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:user_id, params["user_id"] || "anonymous")
    |> assign(:session_id, params["session_id"] || generate_session_id())
    
    {:ok, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def id(socket), do: "user_socket:#{socket.assigns.user_id}"

  defp generate_session_id() do
    :crypto.strong_rand_bytes(16) |> Base.encode64()
  end
end

content.text: Now let me create the main Katalyst channel for handling React component communication:

input.content:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.KatalystChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("katalyst:" <> _session_id, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Katalyst channel joined: #{inspect(socket.assigns)}")
    
    # Initialize session state
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:multithreading_state, %{
      worker_threads: 8,
      active_tasks: [],
      pending_tasks: [],
      completed_tasks: []
    })
    |> assign(:resource_metrics, %{
      cpu: 0,
      memory: 0,
      disk: 0,
      network: %{in: 0, out: 0}
    })
    
    # Start resource monitoring
    schedule_resource_update()
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected", session_id: socket.assigns.session_id}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("multithreading:init", %{"config" => config}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Initializing multithreading with config: #{inspect(config)}")
    
    # Update multithreading configuration
    socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, %{
      worker_threads: config["workerThreads"] || 8,
      auto_scaling: config["enableAutoScaling"] || true,
      websocket_monitoring: config["enableWebSocketMonitoring"] || true,
      pub_sub: config["enablePubSub"] || true,
      active_tasks: [],
      pending_tasks: [],
      completed_tasks: []
    })
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "initialized", config: socket.assigns.multithreading_state}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true  
  def handle_in("task:submit", %{"task" => task_params}, socket) do
    task = %{
      id: task_params["id"] || generate_task_id(),
      type: task_params["type"] || "cpu",
      operation: task_params["operation"],
      data: task_params["data"],
      priority: task_params["priority"] || "normal",
      status: "pending",
      created_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
      thread_id: nil
    }
    
    # Add task to pending queue
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    updated_state = %{state | pending_tasks: [task | state.pending_tasks]}
    socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
    
    # Process task (simulate async processing)
    Process.send_after(self(), {:process_task, task.id}, 100)
    
    Logger.info("Task submitted: #{task.id}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{task_id: task.id, status: "queued"}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("session:create", %{"type" => session_type, "name" => name}, socket) do
    session_id = "session_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(1000)}"
    
    session = %{
      id: session_id,
      name: name || "#{String.capitalize(session_type)} Session",
      type: session_type,
      status: "active",
      created_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
      metrics: %{cpu: 0, memory: 0, throughput: 0, tasks_completed: 0}
    }
    
    # Broadcast session creation
    broadcast(socket, "session:created", %{session: session})
    
    Logger.info("Session created: #{session_id} of type #{session_type}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{session: session}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get", _payload, socket) do
    {:reply, {:ok, socket.assigns.resource_metrics}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:process_task, task_id}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    
    # Move task from pending to active
    case Enum.find(state.pending_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        # Simulate task processing
        updated_task = %{task | 
          status: "running", 
          thread_id: "thread_#{:rand.uniform(8)}",
          started_at: DateTime.utc_now()
        }
        
        pending_tasks = Enum.reject(state.pending_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id))
        active_tasks = [updated_task | state.active_tasks]
        
        updated_state = %{state | 
          pending_tasks: pending_tasks,
          active_tasks: active_tasks
        }
        
        socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
        
        # Broadcast task status update
        broadcast(socket, "task:status_update", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          status: "running",
          thread_id: updated_task.thread_id
        })
        
        # Schedule task completion
        Process.send_after(self(), {:complete_task, task_id}, :rand.uniform(2000) + 1000)
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:complete_task, task_id}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    
    case Enum.find(state.active_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        completed_task = %{task | 
          status: "completed",
          completed_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
          result: %{success: true, data: "Task completed successfully"}
        }
        
        active_tasks = Enum.reject(state.active_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id))
        completed_tasks = [completed_task | state.completed_tasks]
        
        updated_state = %{state |
          active_tasks: active_tasks,
          completed_tasks: completed_tasks
        }
        
        socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
        
        # Broadcast task completion
        broadcast(socket, "task:completed", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          result: completed_task.result,
          duration_ms: DateTime.diff(completed_task.completed_at, completed_task.created_at, :millisecond)
        })
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info(:update_resources, socket) do
    # Simulate resource metrics
    metrics = %{
      cpu: :rand.uniform(100),
      memory: :rand.uniform(100), 
      disk: :rand.uniform(100),
      network: %{
        in: :rand.uniform(1000) / 10,
        out: :rand.uniform(1000) / 10
      }
    }
    
    socket = assign(socket, :resource_metrics, metrics)
    
    # Broadcast resource update
    broadcast(socket, "resources:updated", metrics)
    
    # Schedule next update
    schedule_resource_update()
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  defp schedule_resource_update do
    Process.send_after(self(), :update_resources, 1000)
  end

  defp generate_task_id do
    "task_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(10000)}"
  end
end

content.text: Let me create the terminal channel for handling terminal worker communication:

input.content:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.TerminalChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("terminal:" <> session_id, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Terminal channel joined for session: #{session_id}")
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:terminal_session_id, session_id)
    |> assign(:terminal_state, %{
      rows: 24,
      cols: 80,
      current_directory: "/",
      command_history: [],
      output_buffer: []
    })
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected", session_id: session_id}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:init", %{"config" => config}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Initializing terminal with config: #{inspect(config)}")
    
    terminal_state = %{
      rows: config["rows"] || 24,
      cols: config["cols"] || 80,
      current_directory: config["cwd"] || "/",
      command_history: [],
      output_buffer: [],
      use_webgl: config["useWebGL"] || false,
      enable_gpu: config["enableGPU"] || false
    }
    
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, terminal_state)
    
    # Send initial prompt
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout",
      data: "Welcome to Katalyst Terminal\n$ ",
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "initialized", config: terminal_state}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:execute", %{"command" => command}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Executing terminal command: #{command}")
    
    # Add command to history
    state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
    updated_state = %{state | 
      command_history: [command | state.command_history] |> Enum.take(100)
    }
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
    
    # Simulate command execution
    Process.send_after(self(), {:execute_command, command}, 100)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "executing", command: command}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:input", %{"data" => input_data}, socket) do
    # Handle raw input data (for interactive commands)
    Logger.debug("Terminal input: #{inspect(input_data)}")
    
    # Process input and potentially send output
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout", 
      data: input_data,
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:resize", %{"rows" => rows, "cols" => cols}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
    updated_state = %{state | rows: rows, cols: cols}
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
    
    Logger.info("Terminal resized to #{rows}x#{cols}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{rows: rows, cols: cols}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:execute_command, command}, socket) do
    # Simulate command execution and output
    output = case String.trim(command) do
      "ls" -> 
        "app.js  package.json  src/  node_modules/  README.md\n"
      
      "pwd" ->
        socket.assigns.terminal_state.current_directory <> "\n"
      
      "date" ->
        DateTime.utc_now() |> DateTime.to_string() <> "\n"
      
      "ps" ->
        """
        PID TTY          TIME CMD
        1234 pts/0    00:00:01 katalyst
        5678 pts/0    00:00:00 terminal
        9012 pts/0    00:00:02 node
        """
      
      "clear" ->
        # Send clear command
        push(socket, "terminal:clear", %{})
        ""
      
      cmd when String.starts_with?(cmd, "cd ") ->
        new_dir = String.trim_leading(cmd, "cd ")
        state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
        updated_state = %{state | current_directory: new_dir}
        socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
        ""
      
      unknown ->
        "bash: #{unknown}: command not found\n"
    end
    
    # Send command output
    if output != "" do
      push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
        type: "stdout",
        data: output,
        timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
      })
    end
    
    # Send new prompt
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout", 
      data: "$ ",
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    # Broadcast command execution event
    broadcast(socket, "terminal:command_executed", %{
      session_id: socket.assigns.terminal_session_id,
      command: command,
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end
end

      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end
end

input.content:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.ResourcesChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("resources:" <> _topic, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Resources channel joined")
    
    # Initialize resource monitoring state
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:monitoring_enabled, false)
    |> assign(:update_interval, 1000)
    |> assign(:resource_history, [])
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected"}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("monitoring:start", %{"interval" => interval}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Starting resource monitoring with interval: #{interval}ms")
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:monitoring_enabled, true)
    |> assign(:update_interval, interval)
    
    # Start monitoring
    schedule_resource_update(interval)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "monitoring_started", interval: interval}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("monitoring:stop", _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Stopping resource monitoring")
    
    socket = assign(socket, :monitoring_enabled, false)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "monitoring_stopped"}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get_current", _payload, socket) do
    metrics = get_current_metrics()
    {:reply, {:ok, metrics}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get_history", %{"duration" => duration}, socket) do
    # Get resource history for specified duration
    history = socket.assigns.resource_history
    |> Enum.take(duration)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{history: history}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info(:update_resources, socket) do
    if socket.assigns.monitoring_enabled do
      metrics = get_current_metrics()
      
      # Add to history (keep last 100 entries)
      history = [metrics | socket.assigns.resource_history] |> Enum.take(100)
      socket = assign(socket, :resource_history, history)
      
      # Broadcast metrics update
      broadcast(socket, "resources:updated", metrics)
      
      # Schedule next update
      schedule_resource_update(socket.assigns.update_interval)
    end
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  defp get_current_metrics do
    # Get actual system metrics (simplified simulation for now)
    %{
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now(),
      cpu: %{
        usage_percent: get_cpu_usage(),
        cores: System.schedulers_online(),
        load_average: get_load_average()
      },
      memory: %{
        used_bytes: get_memory_usage(),
        available_bytes: get_available_memory(),
        usage_percent: get_memory_percentage()
      },
      disk: %{
        usage_percent: get_disk_usage(),
        read_iops: :rand.uniform(1000),
        write_iops: :rand.uniform(500),
        read_bandwidth: :rand.uniform(100) * 1024 * 1024,
        write_bandwidth: :rand.uniform(50) * 1024 * 1024
      },
      network: %{
        bytes_in: :rand.uniform(1000) * 1024,
        bytes_out: :rand.uniform(500) * 1024,
        packets_in: :rand.uniform(1000),
        packets_out: :rand.uniform(500)
      },
      processes: %{
        total: :rand.uniform(200) + 100,
        running: :rand.uniform(10) + 5,
        sleeping: :rand.uniform(180) + 90
      },
      threads: %{
        active: :rand.uniform(50) + 20,
        total: :rand.uniform(100) + 50
      }
    }
  end

  defp get_cpu_usage do
    # Simulate CPU usage based on system activity
    base_usage = :rand.uniform(60) + 10
    
    # Add some realistic variation
    case :rand.uniform(10) do
      n when n <= 7 -> base_usage
      8 -> min(95, base_usage + :rand.uniform(30))
      _ -> max(5, base_usage - :rand.uniform(20))
    end
  end

  defp get_memory_usage do
    # Get actual memory info if available, otherwise simulate
    case :erlang.memory() do
      memory_info when is_list(memory_info) ->
        Keyword.get(memory_info, :total, 0)
      _ ->
        # Fallback simulation
        :rand.uniform(2048) * 1024 * 1024
    end
  end

  defp get_available_memory do
    # Simulate available memory
    total_memory = 8 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024  # 8GB
    used = get_memory_usage()
    max(0, total_memory - used)
  end

  defp get_memory_percentage do
    used = get_memory_usage()
    total = used + get_available_memory()
    if total > 0, do: round(used / total * 100), else: 0
  end

  defp get_disk_usage do
    # Simulate disk usage
    :rand.uniform(85) + 5
  end

  defp get_load_average do
    # Simulate load average
    [
      :rand.uniform(400) / 100,  # 1 minute
      :rand.uniform(350) / 100,  # 5 minutes  
      :rand.uniform(300) / 100   # 15 minutes
    ]
  end

  defp schedule_resource_update(interval) do
    Process.send_after(self(), :update_resources, interval)
  end
end

content.text: Let me create the AI tasks channel:

input.content:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.AITasksChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("ai_tasks:" <> _topic, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("AI Tasks channel joined")
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:active_ai_tasks, %{})
    |> assign(:ai_models, ["gpt-4", "claude-3", "llama-2", "local-model"])
    |> assign(:task_queue, [])
    
    {:ok, %{
      status: "connected", 
      available_models: socket.assigns.ai_models
    }, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("ai:submit_task", %{"task" => task_params}, socket) do
    task = %{
      id: task_params["id"] || generate_task_id(),
      type: task_params["type"] || "inference",
      model: task_params["model"] || "gpt-4",
      prompt: task_params["prompt"] || "",
      context: task_params["context"] || %{},
      priority: task_params["priority"] || "normal",
      status: "queued",
      created_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
      estimated_duration: estimate_duration(task_params)
    }
    
    # Add to task queue
    queue = [task | socket.assigns.task_queue]
    socket = assign(socket, :task_queue, queue)
    
    Logger.info("AI task submitted: #{task.id} (#{task.type})")
    
    # Start processing
    Process.send_after(self(), {:process_ai_task, task.id}, 500)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{task_id: task.id, status: "queued", position: length(queue)}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("ai:cancel_task", %{"task_id" => task_id}, socket) do
    # Remove from queue or cancel active task
    queue = Enum.reject(socket.assigns.task_queue, &(&1.id == task_id))
    active_tasks = Map.delete(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id)
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:task_queue, queue)
    |> assign(:active_ai_tasks, active_tasks)
    
    # Broadcast cancellation
    broadcast(socket, "ai:task_cancelled", %{task_id: task_id})
    
    Logger.info("AI task cancelled: #{task_id}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{task_id: task_id, status: "cancelled"}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("ai:get_task_status", %{"task_id" => task_id}, socket) do
    # Check in active tasks first
    case Map.get(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id) do
      nil ->
        # Check in queue
        case Enum.find(socket.assigns.task_queue, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
          nil -> {:reply, {:error, "task_not_found"}, socket}
          task -> {:reply, {:ok, task}, socket}
        end
      task ->
        {:reply, {:ok, task}, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("ai:list_models", _payload, socket) do
    models = socket.assigns.ai_models |> Enum.map(fn model ->
      %{
        name: model,
        status: "available",
        type: get_model_type(model),
        capabilities: get_model_capabilities(model)
      }
    end)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{models: models}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:process_ai_task, task_id}, socket) do
    # Find task in queue
    case Enum.find(socket.assigns.task_queue, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        # Move to active tasks
        queue = Enum.reject(socket.assigns.task_queue, &(&1.id == task_id))
        
        active_task = %{task |
          status: "processing",
          started_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
          progress: 0
        }
        
        active_tasks = Map.put(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id, active_task)
        
        socket = socket
        |> assign(:task_queue, queue)
        |> assign(:active_ai_tasks, active_tasks)
        
        # Broadcast task started
        broadcast(socket, "ai:task_started", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          model: task.model,
          type: task.type
        })
        
        # Simulate processing with progress updates
        schedule_progress_update(task_id, 10)
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:update_progress, task_id, progress}, socket) do
    case Map.get(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        updated_task = %{task | progress: progress}
        active_tasks = Map.put(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id, updated_task)
        socket = assign(socket, :active_ai_tasks, active_tasks)
        
        # Broadcast progress update
        broadcast(socket, "ai:task_progress", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          progress: progress
        })
        
        if progress >= 100 do
          # Task completed
          Process.send_after(self(), {:complete_ai_task, task_id}, 100)
        else
          # Schedule next progress update
          schedule_progress_update(task_id, progress + :rand.uniform(20))
        end
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:complete_ai_task, task_id}, socket) do
    case Map.get(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        # Generate AI response based on task type
        result = generate_ai_response(task)
        
        completed_task = %{task |
          status: "completed",
          completed_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
          result: result,
          progress: 100
        }
        
        active_tasks = Map.delete(socket.assigns.active_ai_tasks, task_id)
        socket = assign(socket, :active_ai_tasks, active_tasks)
        
        # Broadcast completion
        broadcast(socket, "ai:task_completed", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          result: result,
          duration_ms: DateTime.diff(completed_task.completed_at, completed_task.created_at, :millisecond)
        })
        
        Logger.info("AI task completed: #{task_id}")
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  defp generate_task_id do
    "ai_task_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(10000)}"
  end

  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "inference"}), do: :rand.uniform(3000) + 1000
  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "training"}), do: :rand.uniform(10000) + 5000  
  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "analysis"}), do: :rand.uniform(5000) + 2000
  defp estimate_duration(_), do: :rand.uniform(3000) + 1000

  defp schedule_progress_update(task_id, progress) do
    delay = :rand.uniform(1000) + 500
    final_progress = min(100, progress)
    Process.send_after(self(), {:update_progress, task_id, final_progress}, delay)
  end

  defp get_model_type("gpt-4"), do: "language_model"
  defp get_model_type("claude-3"), do: "language_model"
  defp get_model_type("llama-2"), do: "language_model"  
  defp get_model_type("local-model"), do: "local_language_model"
  defp get_model_type(_), do: "unknown"

  defp get_model_capabilities("gpt-4"), do: ["text_generation", "code_generation", "analysis"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("claude-3"), do: ["text_generation", "analysis", "reasoning"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("llama-2"), do: ["text_generation", "conversation"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("local-model"), do: ["text_generation", "privacy"]
  defp get_model_capabilities(_), do: []

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "inference", prompt: prompt, model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "text",
      content: "AI Response from #{model}: Processed prompt '#{String.slice(prompt, 0, 50)}...' successfully",
      tokens_used: :rand.uniform(1000) + 100,
      confidence: :rand.uniform(90) + 10
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "analysis", context: context, model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "analysis",
      insights: [
        "Analysis insight 1 from #{model}",
        "Analysis insight 2 based on context",
        "Key pattern detected in data"
      ],
      confidence: :rand.uniform(85) + 10,
      recommendations: ["Recommendation 1", "Recommendation 2"]
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "training", model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "training_result",
      status: "completed",
      model: model,
      accuracy: :rand.uniform(95) + 5,
      loss: :rand.uniform(100) / 1000,
      epochs_completed: :rand.uniform(100) + 50
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(task) do
    %{
      type: "generic",
      status: "completed",
      task_type: task.type,
      model: task.model,
      message: "Task completed successfully"
    }
  end
end

        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  defp generate_task_id do
    "ai_task_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(10000)}"
  end

  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "inference"}), do: :rand.uniform(3000) + 1000
  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "training"}), do: :rand.uniform(10000) + 5000  
  defp estimate_duration(%{"type" => "analysis"}), do: :rand.uniform(5000) + 2000
  defp estimate_duration(_), do: :rand.uniform(3000) + 1000

  defp schedule_progress_update(task_id, progress) do
    delay = :rand.uniform(1000) + 500
    final_progress = min(100, progress)
    Process.send_after(self(), {:update_progress, task_id, final_progress}, delay)
  end

  defp get_model_type("gpt-4"), do: "language_model"
  defp get_model_type("claude-3"), do: "language_model"
  defp get_model_type("llama-2"), do: "language_model"  
  defp get_model_type("local-model"), do: "local_language_model"
  defp get_model_type(_), do: "unknown"

  defp get_model_capabilities("gpt-4"), do: ["text_generation", "code_generation", "analysis"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("claude-3"), do: ["text_generation", "analysis", "reasoning"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("llama-2"), do: ["text_generation", "conversation"]
  defp get_model_capabilities("local-model"), do: ["text_generation", "privacy"]
  defp get_model_capabilities(_), do: []

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "inference", prompt: prompt, model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "text",
      content: "AI Response from #{model}: Processed prompt '#{String.slice(prompt, 0, 50)}...' successfully",
      tokens_used: :rand.uniform(1000) + 100,
      confidence: :rand.uniform(90) + 10
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "analysis", context: context, model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "analysis",
      insights: [
        "Analysis insight 1 from #{model}",
        "Analysis insight 2 based on context",
        "Key pattern detected in data"
      ],
      confidence: :rand.uniform(85) + 10,
      recommendations: ["Recommendation 1", "Recommendation 2"]
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(%{type: "training", model: model}) do
    %{
      type: "training_result",
      status: "completed",
      model: model,
      accuracy: :rand.uniform(95) + 5,
      loss: :rand.uniform(100) / 1000,
      epochs_completed: :rand.uniform(100) + 50
    }
  end

  defp generate_ai_response(task) do
    %{
      type: "generic",
      status: "completed",
      task_type: task.type,
      model: task.model,
      message: "Task completed successfully"
    }
  end
end

end

toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb do
  @moduledoc """
  The entrypoint for defining your web interface, such
  as controllers, components, channels, and so on.

  This can be used in your application as:

      use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :controller
      use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :html

  The definitions below will be executed for every controller,
  component, etc, so keep them short and clean, focused
  on imports, uses and aliases.

  Do NOT define functions inside the quoted expressions
  below. Instead, define additional modules and import
  those modules here.
  """

  def static_paths, do: ~w(assets fonts images favicon.ico robots.txt)

  def router do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Router, helpers: false

      # Import common connection and controller functions to use in pipelines
      import Plug.Conn
      import Phoenix.Controller
    end
  end

  def channel do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Channel
    end
  end

  def controller do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Controller,
        formats: [:html, :json],
        layouts: [html: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Layouts]

      import Plug.Conn

      unquote(verified_routes())
    end
  end

  def verified_routes do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.VerifiedRoutes,
        endpoint: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Endpoint,
        router: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Router,
        statics: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.static_paths()
    end
  end

  @doc """
  When used, dispatch to the appropriate controller/live_view/etc.
  """
  defmacro __using__(which) when is_atom(which) do
    apply(__MODULE__, which, [])
  end
end

content.text: Now let me create the main dashboard LiveView that will host the React components:

input.content:
defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.KatalystDashboardLive do use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :live_view require Logger @impl true def mount(_params, _session, socket) do if connected?(socket) do # Subscribe to updates Phoenix.PubSub.subscribe(CryptoboxPhoenix.PubSub, "katalyst_updates") # Start resource monitoring send(self(), :start_monitoring) end socket = socket |> assign(:page_title, "Katalyst Dashboard") |> assign(:sessions, []) |> assign(:active_session_id, nil) |> assign(:system_metrics, %{ total_sessions: 0, active_sessions: 0, thread_utilization: 0, memory_usage: 0, task_throughput: 0, queue_backlog: 0, active_threads: 0, completed_tasks: 0 }) |> assign(:multithreading_config, %{ auto_initialize: true, worker_threads: 8, enable_websocket_monitoring: true, enable_pub_sub: true, enable_auto_scaling: true }) |> assign(:component_state, %{ katalyst_mounted: false, react_ready: false, websocket_connected: false }) {:ok, socket} end @impl true def handle_params(params, _url, socket) do {:noreply, apply_action(socket, socket.assigns.live_action, params)} end defp apply_action(socket, :index, _params) do assign(socket, :page_title, "Katalyst Dashboard") end defp apply_action(socket, :dashboard, _params) do assign(socket, :page_title, "Advanced Dashboard") end @impl true def handle_info(:start_monitoring, socket) do # Initialize monitoring intervals :timer.send_interval(2000, self(), :update_metrics) Logger.info("Started Katalyst dashboard monitoring") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_info(:update_metrics, socket) do # Simulate system metrics updates metrics = %{ total_sessions: length(socket.assigns.sessions), active_sessions: Enum.count(socket.assigns.sessions, &(&1.status == "active")), thread_utilization: :rand.uniform(100), memory_usage: :rand.uniform(100), task_throughput: :rand.uniform(1000) / 10, queue_backlog: :rand.uniform(50), active_threads: :rand.uniform(16), completed_tasks: :rand.uniform(10000) } socket = assign(socket, :system_metrics, metrics) {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_info({:session_created, session}, socket) do sessions = [session | socket.assigns.sessions] socket = assign(socket, :sessions, sessions) Logger.info("Session created in LiveView: #{session.id}") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_info({:session_closed, session_id}, socket) do sessions = Enum.reject(socket.assigns.sessions, &(&1.id == session_id)) socket = socket |> assign(:sessions, sessions) |> then(fn socket -> if socket.assigns.active_session_id == session_id do assign(socket, :active_session_id, nil) else socket end end) Logger.info("Session closed in LiveView: #{session_id}") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("react_mounted", _params, socket) do Logger.info("React component mounted successfully") socket = put_in(socket.assigns.component_state.react_ready, true) {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("websocket_connected", _params, socket) do Logger.info("WebSocket connection established from React") socket = put_in(socket.assigns.component_state.websocket_connected, true) {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("create_session", %{"type" => session_type}, socket) do session_id = "session_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(1000)}" session = %{ id: session_id, name: "#{String.capitalize(session_type)} #{length(socket.assigns.sessions) + 1}", type: session_type, status: "active", created_at: DateTime.utc_now(), metrics: %{ cpu: 0, memory: 0, throughput: 0, tasks_completed: 0 } } sessions = [session | socket.assigns.sessions] socket = socket |> assign(:sessions, sessions) |> assign(:active_session_id, session_id) # Broadcast to React components via push_event socket = push_event(socket, "session_created", %{session: session}) Logger.info("Created new session: #{session_id} of type #{session_type}") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("close_session", %{"session_id" => session_id}, socket) do sessions = Enum.reject(socket.assigns.sessions, &(&1.id == session_id)) socket = socket |> assign(:sessions, sessions) |> then(fn socket -> if socket.assigns.active_session_id == session_id do remaining_sessions = sessions new_active = if length(remaining_sessions) > 0, do: hd(remaining_sessions).id, else: nil assign(socket, :active_session_id, new_active) else socket end end) # Broadcast to React components socket = push_event(socket, "session_closed", %{session_id: session_id}) Logger.info("Closed session: #{session_id}") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("select_session", %{"session_id" => session_id}, socket) do socket = assign(socket, :active_session_id, session_id) # Broadcast to React components socket = push_event(socket, "session_selected", %{session_id: session_id}) {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def render(assigns) do ~H"""
K

Katalyst Pro

AI-Optimized Development Environment

{@system_metrics.active_sessions}/{@system_metrics.total_sessions} Sessions
CPU: {@system_metrics.thread_utilization}%
MEM: {@system_metrics.memory_usage}%
Tasks: {@system_metrics.active_threads} active

Loading Katalyst Dashboard...

React Ready: {if @component_state.react_ready, do: "Yes", else: "No"} | WebSocket: {if @component_state.websocket_connected, do: "Connected", else: "Disconnected"}

Debug Information

LiveView State: 
{Jason.encode!(%{
  sessions_count: length(@sessions),
  active_session: @active_session_id,
  multithreading_workers: @multithreading_config.worker_threads,
  react_mounted: @component_state.react_ready
}, pretty: true)}
System Metrics: 
{Jason.encode!(@system_metrics, pretty: true)}
""" end end

then(fn socket -> if socket.assigns.active_session_id == session_id do remaining_sessions = sessions new_active = if length(remaining_sessions) > 0, do: hd(remaining_sessions).id, else: nil assign(socket, :active_session_id, new_active) else socket end end) # Broadcast to React components socket = push_event(socket, "session_closed", %{session_id: session_id}) Logger.info("Closed session: #{session_id}") {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def handle_event("select_session", %{"session_id" => session_id}, socket) do socket = assign(socket, :active_session_id, session_id) # Broadcast to React components socket = push_event(socket, "session_selected", %{session_id: session_id}) {:noreply, socket} end @impl true def render(assigns) do ~H"""
K

Katalyst Pro

AI-Optimized Development Environment

{@system_metrics.active_sessions}/{@system_metrics.total_sessions} Sessions
CPU: {@system_metrics.thread_utilization}%
MEM: {@system_metrics.memory_usage}%
Tasks: {@system_metrics.active_threads} active

Loading Katalyst Dashboard...

React Ready: {if @component_state.react_ready, do: "Yes", else: "No"} | WebSocket: {if @component_state.websocket_connected, do: "Connected", else: "Disconnected"}

Debug Information

LiveView State: 
{Jason.encode!(%{
  sessions_count: length(@sessions),
  active_session: @active_session_id,
  multithreading_workers: @multithreading_config.worker_threads,
  react_mounted: @component_state.react_ready
}, pretty: true)}
System Metrics: 
{Jason.encode!(@system_metrics, pretty: true)}
""" end end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.CoreComponents do @moduledoc """ Provides core UI components for the Katalyst Phoenix-React integration. The components in this module use Tailwind CSS for styling and are designed to work seamlessly with Phoenix LiveView and React components. """ use Phoenix.Component alias Phoenix.LiveView.JS import CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext @doc """ Renders a modal dialog with backdrop. """ attr :id, :string, required: true attr :show, :boolean, default: false attr :on_cancel, JS, default: %JS{} slot :inner_block, required: true def modal(assigns) do ~H"""
<.focus_wrap id={"#{@id}-container"} phx-window-keydown={JS.exec("data-cancel", to: "##{@id}")} phx-key="escape" phx-click-away={JS.exec("data-cancel", to: "##{@id}")} class="shadow-zinc-700/10 ring-zinc-700/10 relative hidden rounded-2xl bg-white p-14 shadow-lg ring-1 transition" >
{render_slot(@inner_block)}
""" end @doc """ Renders a button with various styles. """ attr :type, :string, default: nil attr :class, :string, default: nil attr :rest, :global, include: ~w(disabled form name value) slot :inner_block, required: true def button(assigns) do ~H""" """ end @doc """ Renders an input field with label and error handling. """ attr :id, :any, default: nil attr :name, :any attr :label, :string, default: nil attr :value, :any attr :type, :string, default: "text", values: ~w(checkbox color date datetime-local email file hidden month number password range radio search tel text textarea time url week select) attr :field, Phoenix.HTML.FormField, doc: "a form field struct retrieved from the form, for example: @form[:email]" attr :errors, :list, default: [] attr :checked, :boolean, doc: "the checked flag for checkbox inputs" attr :prompt, :string, default: nil, doc: "the prompt for select inputs" attr :options, :list, doc: "the options to pass to Phoenix.HTML.Form.options_for_select/2" attr :multiple, :boolean, default: false, doc: "the multiple flag for select inputs" attr :rest, :global, include: ~w(accept autocomplete capture cols disabled form list max maxlength min minlength multiple pattern placeholder readonly required rows size step) slot :inner_block def input(%{field: %Phoenix.HTML.FormField{} = field} = assigns) do assigns |> assign(field: nil, id: assigns.id || field.id) |> assign(:errors, Enum.map(field.errors, &translate_error(&1))) |> assign_new(:name, fn -> if assigns.multiple, do: field.name <> "[]", else: field.name end) |> assign_new(:value, fn -> field.value end) |> input() end def input(%{type: "select"} = assigns) do ~H"""
<.label for={@id}>{@label} <.error :for={msg <- @errors}>{msg}
""" end def input(assigns) do ~H"""
<.label for={@id}>{@label} <.error :for={msg <- @errors}>{msg}
""" end @doc """ Renders a label. """ attr :for, :string, default: nil slot :inner_block, required: true def label(assigns) do ~H""" """ end @doc """ Generates a generic error message. """ slot :inner_block, required: true def error(assigns) do ~H"""

<.icon name="hero-exclamation-circle-mini" class="mt-0.5 h-5 w-5 flex-none" /> {render_slot(@inner_block)}

""" end @doc """ Renders a simple icon. """ attr :name, :string, required: true attr :class, :string, default: nil def icon(%{name: "hero-" <> _} = assigns) do ~H""" """ end ## JS Commands def show(js \\ %JS{}, selector) do JS.show(js, to: selector, transition: {"transition-all transform ease-out duration-300", "opacity-0 translate-y-4 sm:translate-y-0 sm:scale-95", "opacity-100 translate-y-0 sm:scale-100"} ) end def hide(js \\ %JS{}, selector) do JS.hide(js, to: selector, time: 200, transition: {"transition-all transform ease-in duration-200", "opacity-100 translate-y-0 sm:scale-100", "opacity-0 translate-y-4 sm:translate-y-0 sm:scale-95"} ) end def show_modal(js \\ %JS{}, id) when is_binary(id) do js |> JS.show(to: "##{id}") |> JS.show( to: "##{id}-bg", transition: {"transition-all transform ease-out duration-300", "opacity-0", "opacity-100"} ) |> show("##{id}-container") |> JS.add_class("overflow-hidden", to: "body") |> JS.focus_first(to: "##{id}-content") end def hide_modal(js \\ %JS{}, id) do js |> JS.hide( to: "##{id}-bg", transition: {"transition-all transform ease-in duration-200", "opacity-100", "opacity-0"} ) |> hide("##{id}-container") |> JS.hide(to: "##{id}", transition: {"block", "block", "hidden"}) |> JS.remove_class("overflow-hidden", to: "body") |> JS.pop_focus() end defp focus_wrap(assigns) do ~H"""
{render_slot(@inner_block)}
""" end @doc """ Translates an error message using gettext. """ defp translate_error({msg, opts}) do # When using gettext, we typically pass the strings we want # to translate as a static argument: # # # Translate "is invalid" in the "errors" domain # dgettext("errors", "is invalid") # # # Translate the number of files with plural rules # dngettext("errors", "1 file", "%{count} files", count) # # Because the error messages we show in our forms and APIs # are defined inside Ecto, we need to translate them dynamically. # This requires us to call the Gettext module passing our gettext # backend as first argument. # # Note we use the "errors" domain, which means translations # should be written to the errors.po file. The :count option is # set by Ecto and indicates we should also apply plural rules. if count = opts[:count] do Gettext.dngettext(CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext, "errors", msg, msg, count, opts) else Gettext.dgettext(CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext, "errors", msg, opts) end end @doc """ Translates the errors for a field from a keyword list of errors. """ def translate_errors(errors, field) when is_list(errors) do for {^field, {msg, opts}} <- errors, do: translate_error({msg, opts}) end end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Layouts do
  @moduledoc """
  This module contains different layouts used by your application.

  See the `layouts` directory for all templates available.
  The "root" layout is a skeleton rendered as part of the
  application router. The "app" layout is set as the default
  layout on both `use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :controller` and
  `use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :live_view`.
  """
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :html

  embed_templates "layouts/*"
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb do
  @moduledoc """
  The entrypoint for defining your web interface, such
  as controllers, components, channels, and so on.

  This can be used in your application as:

      use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :controller
      use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :html

  The definitions below will be executed for every controller,
  component, etc, so keep them short and clean, focused
  on imports, uses and aliases.

  Do NOT define functions inside the quoted expressions
  below. Instead, define additional modules and import
  those modules here.
  """

  def static_paths, do: ~w(assets fonts images favicon.ico robots.txt)

  def router do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Router, helpers: false

      # Import common connection and controller functions to use in pipelines
      import Plug.Conn
      import Phoenix.Controller
    end
  end

  def channel do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Channel
    end
  end

  def controller do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.Controller,
        formats: [:html, :json],
        layouts: [html: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Layouts]

      import Plug.Conn

      unquote(verified_routes())
    end
  end

  def live_view do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.LiveView,
        layout: {CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Layouts, :app}

      unquote(html_helpers())
    end
  end

  def live_component do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.LiveComponent

      unquote(html_helpers())
    end
  end

  defp html_helpers do
    quote do
      # HTML escaping functionality
      import Phoenix.HTML
      # Core UI components and translation
      import CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.CoreComponents

      # Shortcut for generating JS commands
      alias Phoenix.LiveView.JS

      unquote(verified_routes())
    end
  end

  def verified_routes do
    quote do
      use Phoenix.VerifiedRoutes,
        endpoint: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Endpoint,
        router: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Router,
        statics: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.static_paths()
    end
  end

  @doc """
  When used, dispatch to the appropriate controller/live_view/etc.
  """
  defmacro __using__(which) when is_atom(which) do
    apply(__MODULE__, which, [])
  end
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext do
  @moduledoc """
  A module providing Internationalization with a gettext-based API.

  By using [Gettext](https://hexdocs.pm/gettext),
  your module gains a set of macros for translations, for example:

      import CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext

      # Simple translation
      gettext("Here is the string to translate")

      # Plural translation
      ngettext("Here is the string to translate",
               "Here are the strings to translate",
               3)

      # Domain-based translation
      dgettext("errors", "Here is the error message to translate")

  See the [Gettext Docs](https://hexdocs.pm/gettext) for detailed usage.
  """
  use Gettext, otp_app: :cryptobox_phoenix
end

hide("##{@id}")} role="alert" class={[ "fixed top-2 right-2 mr-2 w-80 sm:w-96 z-50 rounded-lg p-3 ring-1", @kind == :info && "bg-emerald-50 text-emerald-800 ring-emerald-500 fill-cyan-900", @kind == :error && "bg-rose-50 text-rose-900 shadow-md ring-rose-500 fill-rose-900" ]} {@rest} >

# are defined inside Ecto, we need to translate them dynamically.
    # This requires us to call the Gettext module passing our gettext
    # backend as first argument.
    #
    # Note we use the "errors" domain, which means translations
    # should be written to the errors.po file. The :count option is
    # set by Ecto and indicates we should also apply plural rules.
    if count = opts[:count] do
      Gettext.dngettext(CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext, "errors", msg, msg, count, opts)
    else

    end
  end

  end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.CoreComponents do @moduledoc """ Provides core UI components for the Katalyst Phoenix-React integration. The components in this module use Tailwind CSS for styling and are designed to work seamlessly with Phoenix LiveView and React components. """ use Phoenix.Component alias Phoenix.LiveView.JS import CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext @doc """ Renders a modal dialog with backdrop. """ attr :id, :string, required: true attr :show, :boolean, default: false attr :on_cancel, JS, default: %JS{} slot :inner_block, required: true def modal(assigns) do ~H"""
<.focus_wrap id={"#{@id}-container"} phx-window-keydown={JS.exec("data-cancel", to: "##{@id}")} phx-key="escape" phx-click-away={JS.exec("data-cancel", to: "##{@id}")} class="shadow-zinc-700/10 ring-zinc-700/10 relative hidden rounded-2xl bg-white p-14 shadow-lg ring-1 transition" >
{render_slot(@inner_block)}
""" end @doc """ Renders a button with various styles. """ attr :type, :string, default: nil attr :class, :string, default: nil attr :rest, :global, include: ~w(disabled form name value) slot :inner_block, required: true def button(assigns) do ~H""" """ end @doc """ Renders an input field with label and error handling. """ attr :id, :any, default: nil attr :name, :any attr :label, :string, default: nil attr :value, :any attr :type, :string, default: "text", values: ~w(checkbox color date datetime-local email file hidden month number password range radio search tel text textarea time url week select) attr :field, Phoenix.HTML.FormField, doc: "a form field struct retrieved from the form, for example: @form[:email]" attr :errors, :list, default: [] attr :checked, :boolean, doc: "the checked flag for checkbox inputs" attr :prompt, :string, default: nil, doc: "the prompt for select inputs" attr :options, :list, doc: "the options to pass to Phoenix.HTML.Form.options_for_select/2" attr :multiple, :boolean, default: false, doc: "the multiple flag for select inputs" attr :rest, :global, include: ~w(accept autocomplete capture cols disabled form list max maxlength min minlength multiple pattern placeholder readonly required rows size step) slot :inner_block def input(%{field: %Phoenix.HTML.FormField{} = field} = assigns) do assigns |> assign(field: nil, id: assigns.id || field.id) |> assign(:errors, Enum.map(field.errors, &translate_error(&1))) |> assign_new(:name, fn -> if assigns.multiple, do: field.name <> "[]", else: field.name end) |> assign_new(:value, fn -> field.value end) |> input() end def input(%{type: "select"} = assigns) do ~H"""
<.label for={@id}>{@label} <.error :for={msg <- @errors}>{msg}
""" end def input(assigns) do ~H"""
<.label for={@id}>{@label} <.error :for={msg <- @errors}>{msg}
""" end @doc """ Renders a label. """ attr :for, :string, default: nil slot :inner_block, required: true def label(assigns) do ~H""" """ end @doc """ Generates a generic error message. """ slot :inner_block, required: true def error(assigns) do ~H"""

<.icon name="hero-exclamation-circle-mini" class="mt-0.5 h-5 w-5 flex-none" /> {render_slot(@inner_block)}

""" end @doc """ Renders a simple icon. """ attr :name, :string, required: true attr :class, :string, default: nil def icon(%{name: "hero-" <> _} = assigns) do ~H""" """ end ## JS Commands def show(js \\ %JS{}, selector) do JS.show(js, to: selector, transition: {"transition-all transform ease-out duration-300", "opacity-0 translate-y-4 sm:translate-y-0 sm:scale-95", "opacity-100 translate-y-0 sm:scale-100"} ) end def hide(js \\ %JS{}, selector) do JS.hide(js, to: selector, time: 200, transition: {"transition-all transform ease-in duration-200", "opacity-100 translate-y-0 sm:scale-100", "opacity-0 translate-y-4 sm:translate-y-0 sm:scale-95"} ) end def show_modal(js \\ %JS{}, id) when is_binary(id) do js |> JS.show(to: "##{id}") |> JS.show( to: "##{id}-bg", transition: {"transition-all transform ease-out duration-300", "opacity-0", "opacity-100"} ) |> show("##{id}-container") |> JS.add_class("overflow-hidden", to: "body") |> JS.focus_first(to: "##{id}-content") end def hide_modal(js \\ %JS{}, id) do js |> JS.hide( to: "##{id}-bg", transition: {"transition-all transform ease-in duration-200", "opacity-100", "opacity-0"} ) |> hide("##{id}-container") |> JS.hide(to: "##{id}", transition: {"block", "block", "hidden"}) |> JS.remove_class("overflow-hidden", to: "body") |> JS.pop_focus() end defp focus_wrap(assigns) do ~H"""
{render_slot(@inner_block)}
""" end @doc """ Translates an error message using gettext. """ defp translate_error({msg, opts}) do # When using gettext, we typically pass the strings we want # to translate as a static argument: # # # Translate "is invalid" in the "errors" domain # dgettext("errors", "is invalid") # # # Translate the number of files with plural rules # dngettext("errors", "1 file", "%{count} files", count) # # Because the error messages we show in our forms and APIs # are defined inside Ecto, we need to translate them dynamically. # This requires us to call the Gettext module passing our gettext # backend as first argument. # # Note we use the "errors" domain, which means translations # should be written to the errors.po file. The :count option is # set by Ecto and indicates we should also apply plural rules. if count = opts[:count] do Gettext.dngettext(CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext, "errors", msg, msg, count, opts) else Gettext.dgettext(CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Gettext, "errors", msg, opts) end end @doc """ Translates the errors for a field from a keyword list of errors. """ def translate_errors(errors, field) when is_list(errors) do for {^field, {msg, opts}} <- errors, do: translate_error({msg, opts}) end end

     1// Include phoenix_html to handle method=PUT/DELETE in forms and buttons.
     2import "phoenix_html"
     3// Establish Phoenix Socket and LiveView configuration.
     4import {Socket} from "phoenix"
     5import {LiveSocket} from "phoenix_live_view"
     6import topbar from "../vendor/topbar"
     7
     8// Import React and ReactDOM
     9import React from "react"
    10import { createRoot } from "react-dom/client"
    11
    12// Import our React components
    13import { KatalystAdvancedDashboard } from "./react/katalyst_dashboard"
    14import { ReactPhoenixBridge } from "./react/phoenix_bridge"
    15
    16// Phoenix Socket setup
    17let csrfToken = document.querySelector("meta[name='csrf-token']").getAttribute("content")
    18
    19// LiveView Hooks for React Integration
    20let Hooks = {}
    21
    22// Katalyst Dashboard Hook - Mounts React component and manages Phoenix bridge
    23Hooks.KatalystDashboard = {
    24  mounted() {
    25    const container = this.el
    26    const props = {
    27      multithreadingConfig: JSON.parse(container.dataset.multithreadingConfig),
    28      systemMetrics: JSON.parse(container.dataset.systemMetrics),
    29      sessions: JSON.parse(container.dataset.sessions),
    30      activeSessionId: container.dataset.activeSessionId,
    31      websocketUrl: container.dataset.websocketUrl
    32    }
    33
    34    // Initialize Phoenix bridge
    35    this.bridge = new ReactPhoenixBridge(this, props.websocketUrl)
    36    
    37    // Create React root and render dashboard
    38    this.root = createRoot(container)
    39    this.root.render(
    40      React.createElement(KatalystAdvancedDashboard, {
    41        ...props,
    42        bridge: this.bridge,
    43        onMount: () => {
    44          // Notify LiveView that React is ready
    45          this.pushEvent("react_mounted", {})
    46        },
    47        onWebSocketConnect: () => {
    48          // Notify LiveView of WebSocket connection
    49          this.pushEvent("websocket_connected", {})
    50        }
    51      })
    52    )
    53
    54    // Handle LiveView events
    55    this.handleEvent("session_created", (payload) => {
    56      this.bridge.handleSessionCreated(payload.session)
    57    })
    58
    59    this.handleEvent("session_closed", (payload) => {
    60      this.bridge.handleSessionClosed(payload.session_id)
    61    })
    62
    63    this.handleEvent("session_selected", (payload) => {
    64      this.bridge.handleSessionSelected(payload.session_id)
    65    })
    66
    67    console.log("Katalyst Dashboard Hook mounted successfully")
    68  },
    69
    70  updated() {
    71    // Update React component props when LiveView updates
    72    const container = this.el
    73    const props = {
    74      multithreadingConfig: JSON.parse(container.dataset.multithreadingConfig),
    75      systemMetrics: JSON.parse(container.dataset.systemMetrics),
    76      sessions: JSON.parse(container.dataset.sessions),
    77      activeSessionId: container.dataset.activeSessionId,
    78      websocketUrl: container.dataset.websocketUrl
    79    }
    80
    81    if (this.bridge) {
    82      this.bridge.updateProps(props)
    83    }
    84  },
    85
    86  destroyed() {
    87    // Cleanup React component and Phoenix bridge
    88    if (this.root) {
    89      this.root.unmount()
    90    }
    91    if (this.bridge) {
    92      this.bridge.disconnect()
    93    }
    94    console.log("Katalyst Dashboard Hook destroyed")
    95  }
    96}
    97
    98// LiveSocket configuration
    99let liveSocket = new LiveSocket("/live", Socket, {
   100  longPollFallbackMs: 2500,
   101  params: {_csrf_token: csrfToken},
   102  hooks: Hooks
   103})
   104
   105// Show progress bar on live navigation and form submits
   106topbar.config({barColors: {0: "#29d"}, shadowColor: "rgba(0, 0, 0, .3)"})
   107window.addEventListener("phx:page-loading-start", _info => topbar.show(300))
   108window.addEventListener("phx:page-loading-stop", _info => topbar.hide())
   109
   110// Connect if there are any LiveViews on the page
   111liveSocket.connect()
   112
   113// Make liveSocket available for browser console debugging
   114window.liveSocket = liveSocket
   115
   116console.log("Katalyst Phoenix-React app initialized successfully")
   117
   118

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Endpoint do
  use Phoenix.Endpoint, otp_app: :cryptobox_phoenix

  # The session will be stored in the cookie and signed,
  # this means its contents can be read but not tampered with.
  # Set :encryption_salt if you would also like to encrypt it.
  @session_options [
    store: :cookie,
    key: "_cryptobox_phoenix_key",
    signing_salt: "e4QF3kZZ",
    same_site: "Lax"
  ]

  socket "/live", Phoenix.LiveView.Socket,
    websocket: [connect_info: [session: @session_options]],
    longpoll: [connect_info: [session: @session_options]]
  
  socket "/socket", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.UserSocket,
    websocket: true,
    longpoll: false

  # Serve at "/" the static files from "priv/static" directory.
  #
  # You should set gzip to true if you are running phx.digest
  # when deploying your static files in production.
  plug Plug.Static,
    at: "/",
    from: :cryptobox_phoenix,
    gzip: false,
    only: CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.static_paths()

  # Code reloading can be explicitly enabled under the
  # :code_reloader configuration of your endpoint.
  if code_reloading? do
    plug Phoenix.CodeReloader
  end

  plug Plug.RequestId
  plug Plug.Telemetry, event_prefix: [:phoenix, :endpoint]

  plug Plug.Parsers,
    parsers: [:urlencoded, :multipart, :json],
    pass: ["*/*"],
    json_decoder: Phoenix.json_library()

  plug Plug.MethodOverride
  plug Plug.Head
  plug Plug.Session, @session_options
  plug CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.Router
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.UserSocket do
  use Phoenix.Socket

  # Channels for Katalyst integration
  channel "katalyst:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.KatalystChannel
  channel "terminal:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.TerminalChannel
  channel "resources:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.ResourcesChannel
  channel "ai_tasks:*", CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.AITasksChannel

  @impl true
  def connect(params, socket, _connect_info) do
    # For now, accept all connections
    # In production, implement proper authentication
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:user_id, params["user_id"] || "anonymous")
    |> assign(:session_id, params["session_id"] || generate_session_id())
    
    {:ok, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def id(socket), do: "user_socket:#{socket.assigns.user_id}"

  defp generate_session_id() do
    :crypto.strong_rand_bytes(16) |> Base.encode64()
  end
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.KatalystChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("katalyst:" <> _session_id, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Katalyst channel joined: #{inspect(socket.assigns)}")
    
    # Initialize session state
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:multithreading_state, %{
      worker_threads: 8,
      active_tasks: [],
      pending_tasks: [],
      completed_tasks: []
    })
    |> assign(:resource_metrics, %{
      cpu: 0,
      memory: 0,
      disk: 0,
      network: %{in: 0, out: 0}
    })
    
    # Start resource monitoring
    schedule_resource_update()
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected", session_id: socket.assigns.session_id}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("multithreading:init", %{"config" => config}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Initializing multithreading with config: #{inspect(config)}")
    
    # Update multithreading configuration
    socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, %{
      worker_threads: config["workerThreads"] || 8,
      auto_scaling: config["enableAutoScaling"] || true,
      websocket_monitoring: config["enableWebSocketMonitoring"] || true,
      pub_sub: config["enablePubSub"] || true,
      active_tasks: [],
      pending_tasks: [],
      completed_tasks: []
    })
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "initialized", config: socket.assigns.multithreading_state}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true  
  def handle_in("task:submit", %{"task" => task_params}, socket) do
    task = %{
      id: task_params["id"] || generate_task_id(),
      type: task_params["type"] || "cpu",
      operation: task_params["operation"],
      data: task_params["data"],
      priority: task_params["priority"] || "normal",
      status: "pending",
      created_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
      thread_id: nil
    }
    
    # Add task to pending queue
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    updated_state = %{state | pending_tasks: [task | state.pending_tasks]}
    socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
    
    # Process task (simulate async processing)
    Process.send_after(self(), {:process_task, task.id}, 100)
    
    Logger.info("Task submitted: #{task.id}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{task_id: task.id, status: "queued"}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("session:create", %{"type" => session_type, "name" => name}, socket) do
    session_id = "session_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(1000)}"
    
    session = %{
      id: session_id,
      name: name || "#{String.capitalize(session_type)} Session",
      type: session_type,
      status: "active",
      created_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
      metrics: %{cpu: 0, memory: 0, throughput: 0, tasks_completed: 0}
    }
    
    # Broadcast session creation
    broadcast(socket, "session:created", %{session: session})
    
    Logger.info("Session created: #{session_id} of type #{session_type}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{session: session}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get", _payload, socket) do
    {:reply, {:ok, socket.assigns.resource_metrics}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:process_task, task_id}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    
    # Move task from pending to active
    case Enum.find(state.pending_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        # Simulate task processing
        updated_task = %{task | 
          status: "running", 
          thread_id: "thread_#{:rand.uniform(8)}",
          started_at: DateTime.utc_now()
        }
        
        pending_tasks = Enum.reject(state.pending_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id))
        active_tasks = [updated_task | state.active_tasks]
        
        updated_state = %{state | 
          pending_tasks: pending_tasks,
          active_tasks: active_tasks
        }
        
        socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
        
        # Broadcast task status update
        broadcast(socket, "task:status_update", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          status: "running",
          thread_id: updated_task.thread_id
        })
        
        # Schedule task completion
        Process.send_after(self(), {:complete_task, task_id}, :rand.uniform(2000) + 1000)
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:complete_task, task_id}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.multithreading_state
    
    case Enum.find(state.active_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id)) do
      nil ->
        {:noreply, socket}
        
      task ->
        completed_task = %{task | 
          status: "completed",
          completed_at: DateTime.utc_now(),
          result: %{success: true, data: "Task completed successfully"}
        }
        
        active_tasks = Enum.reject(state.active_tasks, &(&1.id == task_id))
        completed_tasks = [completed_task | state.completed_tasks]
        
        updated_state = %{state |
          active_tasks: active_tasks,
          completed_tasks: completed_tasks
        }
        
        socket = assign(socket, :multithreading_state, updated_state)
        
        # Broadcast task completion
        broadcast(socket, "task:completed", %{
          task_id: task_id,
          result: completed_task.result,
          duration_ms: DateTime.diff(completed_task.completed_at, completed_task.created_at, :millisecond)
        })
        
        {:noreply, socket}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info(:update_resources, socket) do
    # Simulate resource metrics
    metrics = %{
      cpu: :rand.uniform(100),
      memory: :rand.uniform(100), 
      disk: :rand.uniform(100),
      network: %{
        in: :rand.uniform(1000) / 10,
        out: :rand.uniform(1000) / 10
      }
    }
    
    socket = assign(socket, :resource_metrics, metrics)
    
    # Broadcast resource update
    broadcast(socket, "resources:updated", metrics)
    
    # Schedule next update
    schedule_resource_update()
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  defp schedule_resource_update do
    Process.send_after(self(), :update_resources, 1000)
  end

  defp generate_task_id do
    "task_#{:os.system_time(:millisecond)}_#{:rand.uniform(10000)}"
  end
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.TerminalChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("terminal:" <> session_id, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Terminal channel joined for session: #{session_id}")
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:terminal_session_id, session_id)
    |> assign(:terminal_state, %{
      rows: 24,
      cols: 80,
      current_directory: "/",
      command_history: [],
      output_buffer: []
    })
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected", session_id: session_id}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:init", %{"config" => config}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Initializing terminal with config: #{inspect(config)}")
    
    terminal_state = %{
      rows: config["rows"] || 24,
      cols: config["cols"] || 80,
      current_directory: config["cwd"] || "/",
      command_history: [],
      output_buffer: [],
      use_webgl: config["useWebGL"] || false,
      enable_gpu: config["enableGPU"] || false
    }
    
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, terminal_state)
    
    # Send initial prompt
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout",
      data: "Welcome to Katalyst Terminal\n$ ",
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "initialized", config: terminal_state}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:execute", %{"command" => command}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Executing terminal command: #{command}")
    
    # Add command to history
    state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
    updated_state = %{state | 
      command_history: [command | state.command_history] |> Enum.take(100)
    }
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
    
    # Simulate command execution
    Process.send_after(self(), {:execute_command, command}, 100)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "executing", command: command}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:input", %{"data" => input_data}, socket) do
    # Handle raw input data (for interactive commands)
    Logger.debug("Terminal input: #{inspect(input_data)}")
    
    # Process input and potentially send output
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout", 
      data: input_data,
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("terminal:resize", %{"rows" => rows, "cols" => cols}, socket) do
    state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
    updated_state = %{state | rows: rows, cols: cols}
    socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
    
    Logger.info("Terminal resized to #{rows}x#{cols}")
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{rows: rows, cols: cols}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info({:execute_command, command}, socket) do
    # Simulate command execution and output
    output = case String.trim(command) do
      "ls" -> 
        "app.js  package.json  src/  node_modules/  README.md\n"
      
      "pwd" ->
        socket.assigns.terminal_state.current_directory <> "\n"
      
      "date" ->
        DateTime.utc_now() |> DateTime.to_string() <> "\n"
      
      "ps" ->
        """
        PID TTY          TIME CMD
        1234 pts/0    00:00:01 katalyst
        5678 pts/0    00:00:00 terminal
        9012 pts/0    00:00:02 node
        """
      
      "clear" ->
        # Send clear command
        push(socket, "terminal:clear", %{})
        ""
      
      cmd when String.starts_with?(cmd, "cd ") ->
        new_dir = String.trim_leading(cmd, "cd ")
        state = socket.assigns.terminal_state
        updated_state = %{state | current_directory: new_dir}
        socket = assign(socket, :terminal_state, updated_state)
        ""
      
      unknown ->
        "bash: #{unknown}: command not found\n"
    end
    
    # Send command output
    if output != "" do
      push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
        type: "stdout",
        data: output,
        timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
      })
    end
    
    # Send new prompt
    push(socket, "terminal:output", %{
      type: "stdout", 
      data: "$ ",
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    # Broadcast command execution event
    broadcast(socket, "terminal:command_executed", %{
      session_id: socket.assigns.terminal_session_id,
      command: command,
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now()
    })
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end
end

defmodule CryptoboxPhoenixWeb.ResourcesChannel do
  use CryptoboxPhoenixWeb, :channel
  require Logger

  @impl true
  def join("resources:" <> _topic, _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Resources channel joined")
    
    # Initialize resource monitoring state
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:monitoring_enabled, false)
    |> assign(:update_interval, 1000)
    |> assign(:resource_history, [])
    
    {:ok, %{status: "connected"}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("monitoring:start", %{"interval" => interval}, socket) do
    Logger.info("Starting resource monitoring with interval: #{interval}ms")
    
    socket = socket
    |> assign(:monitoring_enabled, true)
    |> assign(:update_interval, interval)
    
    # Start monitoring
    schedule_resource_update(interval)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "monitoring_started", interval: interval}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("monitoring:stop", _payload, socket) do
    Logger.info("Stopping resource monitoring")
    
    socket = assign(socket, :monitoring_enabled, false)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{status: "monitoring_stopped"}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get_current", _payload, socket) do
    metrics = get_current_metrics()
    {:reply, {:ok, metrics}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_in("resources:get_history", %{"duration" => duration}, socket) do
    # Get resource history for specified duration
    history = socket.assigns.resource_history
    |> Enum.take(duration)
    
    {:reply, {:ok, %{history: history}}, socket}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info(:update_resources, socket) do
    if socket.assigns.monitoring_enabled do
      metrics = get_current_metrics()
      
      # Add to history (keep last 100 entries)
      history = [metrics | socket.assigns.resource_history] |> Enum.take(100)
      socket = assign(socket, :resource_history, history)
      
      # Broadcast metrics update
      broadcast(socket, "resources:updated", metrics)
      
      # Schedule next update
      schedule_resource_update(socket.assigns.update_interval)
    end
    
    {:noreply, socket}
  end

  defp get_current_metrics do
    # Get actual system metrics (simplified simulation for now)
    %{
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now(),
      cpu: %{
        usage_percent: get_cpu_usage(),
        cores: System.schedulers_online(),
        load_average: get_load_average()
      },
      memory: %{
        used_bytes: get_memory_usage(),
        available_bytes: get_available_memory(),
        usage_percent: get_memory_percentage()
      },
      disk: %{
        usage_percent: get_disk_usage(),
        read_iops: :rand.uniform(1000),
        write_iops: :rand.uniform(500),
        read_bandwidth: :rand.uniform(100) * 1024 * 1024,
        write_bandwidth: :rand.uniform(50) * 1024 * 1024
      },
      network: %{
        bytes_in: :rand.uniform(1000) * 1024,
        bytes_out: :rand.uniform(500) * 1024,
        packets_in: :rand.uniform(1000),
        packets_out: :rand.uniform(500)
      },
      processes: %{
        total: :rand.uniform(200) + 100,
        running: :rand.uniform(10) + 5,
        sleeping: :rand.uniform(180) + 90
      },
      threads: %{
        active: :rand.uniform(50) + 20,
        total: :rand.uniform(100) + 50
      }
    }
  end

  defp get_cpu_usage do
    # Simulate CPU usage based on system activity
    base_usage = :rand.uniform(60) + 10
    
    # Add some realistic variation
    case :rand.uniform(10) do
      n when n <= 7 -> base_usage
      8 -> min(95, base_usage + :rand.uniform(30))
      _ -> max(5, base_usage - :rand.uniform(20))
    end
  end

  defp get_memory_usage do
    # Get actual memory info if available, otherwise simulate
    case :erlang.memory() do
      memory_info when is_list(memory_info) ->
        Keyword.get(memory_info, :total, 0)
      _ ->
        # Fallback simulation
        :rand.uniform(2048) * 1024 * 1024
    end
  end

  defp get_available_memory do
    # Simulate available memory
    total_memory = 8 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024  # 8GB
    used = get_memory_usage()
    max(0, total_memory - used)
  end

  defp get_memory_percentage do
    used = get_memory_usage()
    total = used + get_available_memory()
    if total > 0, do: round(used / total * 100), else: 0
  end

  defp get_disk_usage do
    # Simulate disk usage
    :rand.uniform(85) + 5
  end

  defp get_load_average do
    # Simulate load average
    [
      :rand.uniform(400) / 100,  # 1 minute
      :rand.uniform(350) / 100,  # 5 minutes  
      :rand.uniform(300) / 100   # 15 minutes
    ]
  end

  defp schedule_resource_update(interval) do
    Process.send_after(self(), :update_resources, interval)
  end
end

The file /home/ubuntu/src/repos/manifolded/crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy/lib/cryptobox_phoenix_web/channels/ai_tasks_channel.ex has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
