  namespace: manifolded-quantum
  labels:
    app: quantum-engine
    component: secrets
type: Opaque
data:
  # Quantum cryptographic keys
  master-key: <BASE64_ENCODED_QUANTUM_MASTER_KEY>
  lattice-private-key: <BASE64_ENCODED_LATTICE_PRIVATE_KEY>
  bb84-seed: <BASE64_ENCODED_BB84_SEED>
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: economic-crypto-keys
  namespace: manifolded-economic
  labels:
    app: economic-engine
    component: secrets
type: Opaque
data:
  # Economic engine cryptographic keys
  signing-key: <BASE64_ENCODED_SIGNING_KEY>
  encryption-key: <BASE64_ENCODED_ENCRYPTION_KEY>
  payment-processor-api-key: <BASE64_ENCODED_PAYMENT_API_KEY>
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: monitoring-basic-auth
  namespace: manifolded-monitoring
  labels:
    app: monitoring
    component: secrets
type: kubernetes.io/basic-auth
data:
  # Basic auth for monitoring endpoints
  username: <BASE64_ENCODED_MONITORING_USERNAME>  # e.g.: admin
  password: <BASE64_ENCODED_MONITORING_PASSWORD>  # Generate strong password
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: grafana-admin
  namespace: manifolded-monitoring
  labels:
    app: grafana
    component: secrets
type: Opaque
data:
  # Grafana admin credentials
  admin-user: <BASE64_ENCODED_GRAFANA_ADMIN_USER>      # e.g.: admin
  admin-password: <BASE64_ENCODED_GRAFANA_ADMIN_PASSWORD>
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: prometheus-config-secret
  namespace: manifolded-monitoring
  labels:
    app: prometheus
    component: secrets
type: Opaque
data:
  # Prometheus configuration secrets (if needed for external systems)
  alertmanager-webhook-url: <BASE64_ENCODED_WEBHOOK_URL>
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: tls-certificates
  namespace: manifolded-system
  labels:
    app: manifolded
    component: certificates
type: kubernetes.io/tls
data:
  # TLS certificates for internal communication
  tls.crt: <BASE64_ENCODED_TLS_CERTIFICATE>
  tls.key: <BASE64_ENCODED_TLS_PRIVATE_KEY>
  ca.crt: <BASE64_ENCODED_CA_CERTIFICATE>
---
# External Secrets Operator integration (if using AWS Secrets Manager, HashiCorp Vault, etc.)
apiVersion: external-secrets.io/v1beta1
kind: SecretStore
metadata:
  name: vault-backend
  namespace: manifolded-system
spec:
  provider:
    vault:
      server: "https://vault.manifolded.internal:8200"
      path: "secret"
      version: "v2"
      auth:
        kubernetes:
          mountPath: "kubernetes"
          role: "manifolded"
          secretRef:
            name: "vault-token"
            key: "token"
---
apiVersion: external-secrets.io/v1beta1
kind: ExternalSecret
metadata:
  name: vault-phoenix-secrets
  namespace: manifolded-system
spec:
  refreshInterval: 15s
  secretStoreRef:
    name: vault-backend
    kind: SecretStore
  target:
    name: phoenix-secrets
    creationPolicy: Owner
  data:
  - secretKey: release-cookie
    remoteRef:
      key: phoenix/config
      property: release_cookie
  - secretKey: secret-key-base
    remoteRef:
      key: phoenix/config
      property: secret_key_base
  - secretKey: liveview-salt
    remoteRef:
      key: phoenix/config
      property: liveview_salt
  - secretKey: db-password
    remoteRef:
      key: database/credentials
      property: phoenix_password

input.content:
# Manifolded Kubernetes Deployment

This directory contains comprehensive Kubernetes manifests for deploying the Manifolded platform across multiple environments with enterprise-grade security, monitoring, and scalability.

## Architecture Overview

The Manifolded platform is deployed across multiple Kubernetes namespaces with strict security boundaries:

- **manifolded-system**: Core platform services (Phoenix dashboard, databases)
- **manifolded-quantum**: Quantum computing specialization
- **manifolded-economic**: Economic engine and payment processing  
- **manifolded-ai**: AI consciousness and agent management
- **manifolded-integration**: Cross-specialization integration services
- **manifolded-monitoring**: Observability stack (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger, Loki)

## Success Metrics

### Performance Targets
- **Quantum Operations**: <1ms latency for key generation, >99.9% uptime
- **Payment Processing**: <50ms latency for transactions, 10,000+ TPS capability
- **AI Agent Response**: <30s for complex queries, 100+ concurrent agents
- **Platform Availability**: 99.99% uptime (52.6 minutes downtime/year)

### Security Objectives  
- **Zero-Trust**: All inter-service communication authenticated and encrypted
- **Compliance**: SOC2 Type II, ISO27001, GDPR, HIPAA ready
- **Threat Detection**: <5 minute mean time to detection (MTTD)
- **Incident Response**: <15 minute mean time to containment (MTTC)

### Scalability Requirements
- **Global Deployment**: Multi-region with <100ms cross-region latency
- **Auto-scaling**: 10x capacity scaling within 5 minutes
- **Resource Efficiency**: >70% CPU/memory utilization targets
- **Cost Optimization**: 30% reduction through intelligent scheduling

## Prerequisites

### Cluster Requirements
- Kubernetes 1.25+
- NVIDIA GPU support for AI workloads
- Persistent volume support (AWS EBS, GCP PD, Azure Disk)
- Ingress controller (NGINX recommended)
- Service mesh (Istio optional but recommended)

### Node Labels Required
```bash
# High-performance nodes for economic processing
kubectl label nodes <node-name> manifolded.ai/high-performance=true

# GPU nodes for AI consciousness
kubectl label nodes <node-name> manifolded.ai/gpu-enabled=true

# Quantum-enabled nodes (specialized hardware)
kubectl label nodes <node-name> manifolded.ai/quantum-enabled=true

# Monitoring nodes
kubectl label nodes <node-name> manifolded.ai/monitoring=true

# Web tier nodes  
kubectl label nodes <node-name> manifolded.ai/web-tier=true
```

### Secrets Management
Before deployment, populate secrets with actual values:

```bash
# Generate strong secrets
export PHOENIX_SECRET_KEY_BASE=$(openssl rand -base64 64)
export PHOENIX_RELEASE_COOKIE=$(openssl rand -base64 32)
export POSTGRES_PASSWORD=$(openssl rand -base64 32)

# Apply with actual values
sed -i "s/<BASE64_ENCODED_SECRET_KEY>/$(echo -n $PHOENIX_SECRET_KEY_BASE | base64 -w 0)/g" k8s/secrets/secrets.yaml
```

## Quick Deployment

### 1. Deploy Core Infrastructure
```bash
# Create namespaces
kubectl apply -f k8s/namespaces/

# Deploy RBAC
kubectl apply -f k8s/rbac/

# Deploy secrets (after populating with real values)
kubectl apply -f k8s/secrets/

# Deploy storage classes and PVCs
kubectl apply -f k8s/storage/
```

### 2. Deploy Platform Services
```bash
# Deploy configuration
kubectl apply -f k8s/configmaps/

# Deploy core services
kubectl apply -f k8s/deployments/

# Deploy service definitions
kubectl apply -f k8s/services/

# Deploy network policies
kubectl apply -f k8s/networking/
```

### 3. Deploy Monitoring Stack
```bash
# Deploy Prometheus and monitoring
kubectl apply -f k8s/monitoring/

# Deploy ingress controllers
kubectl apply -f k8s/ingress/
```

### 4. Verify Deployment
```bash
# Check all pods are running
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces

# Check services are accessible
kubectl get svc --all-namespaces

# Verify ingress
kubectl get ingress --all-namespaces
```

## Advanced Configuration

### Auto-scaling Configuration
```yaml
apiVersion: autoscaling/v2
kind: HorizontalPodAutoscaler
metadata:
  name: economic-engine-hpa
  namespace: manifolded-economic
spec:
  scaleTargetRef:
    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    name: economic-engine
  minReplicas: 5
  maxReplicas: 50
  metrics:
  - type: Resource
    resource:
      name: cpu
      target:
        type: Utilization
        averageUtilization: 70
  - type: Resource
    resource:
      name: memory
      target:
        type: Utilization
        averageUtilization: 80
  - type: Pods
    pods:
      metric:
        name: economic_payment_queue_length
      target:
        type: AverageValue
        averageValue: "100"
```

### Service Mesh Integration (Istio)
```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Namespace
metadata:
  name: manifolded-quantum
  labels:
    istio-injection: enabled
---
apiVersion: security.istio.io/v1beta1
kind: AuthorizationPolicy
metadata:
  name: quantum-access-control
  namespace: manifolded-quantum
spec:
  rules:
  - from:
    - source:
        namespaces: ["manifolded-integration", "manifolded-system"]
    to:
    - operation:
        methods: ["GET", "POST"]
        paths: ["/api/*"]
```

### Multi-Region Deployment
```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: economic-engine-global
  annotations:
    service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type: "nlb"
    service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-cross-zone-load-balancing-enabled: "true"
    external-dns.alpha.kubernetes.io/hostname: economic.manifolded.ai
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: economic-engine
  ports:
  - port: 443
    targetPort: 8080
```

## Production Deployment

### 1. Environment-Specific Overlays
```bash
# Development environment
kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/dev/

# Staging environment  
kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/staging/

# Production environment
kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/prod/
```

### 2. Disaster Recovery Setup
```bash
# Cross-region backup
kubectl apply -f k8s/backup/velero-backup.yaml

# Database replication
kubectl apply -f k8s/backup/postgres-replica.yaml

# State synchronization
kubectl apply -f k8s/backup/state-sync.yaml
```

### 3. Security Hardening
```bash
# Pod security policies
kubectl apply -f k8s/security/pod-security-policies.yaml

# Network policies
kubectl apply -f k8s/networking/network-policies.yaml  

# Service mesh security
kubectl apply -f k8s/security/istio-security.yaml
```

## Monitoring & Observability

### Key Dashboards
- **Platform Overview**: `/grafana/d/platform-overview`
- **Quantum Metrics**: `/grafana/d/quantum-specialization`
- **Economic Performance**: `/grafana/d/economic-engine`
- **AI Agent Health**: `/grafana/d/ai-consciousness`

### Critical Alerts
- **Quantum Coherence**: Coherence time < 500ms
- **Payment Latency**: 95th percentile > 50ms  
- **AI Memory Usage**: >10GB per agent
- **Security Events**: Anomalous access patterns

### Log Aggregation
- **Application Logs**: Structured JSON via Loki
- **Security Logs**: Audit trail via Elasticsearch
- **Trace Data**: Distributed tracing via Jaeger
- **Metrics**: Time-series via Prometheus

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Pod Startup Failures
```bash
# Check pod events
kubectl describe pod <pod-name> -n <namespace>

# Check logs  
kubectl logs <pod-name> -n <namespace> --previous

# Check resource constraints
kubectl top pods -n <namespace>
```

#### Network Connectivity
```bash
# Test service connectivity
kubectl run test-pod --image=busybox --rm -it -- nslookup quantum-engine.manifolded-quantum

# Check network policies
kubectl describe networkpolicy -n <namespace>

# Verify DNS resolution
kubectl exec -it <pod-name> -n <namespace> -- nslookup kubernetes.default
```

#### Performance Issues
```bash
# Check resource usage
kubectl top nodes
kubectl top pods --all-namespaces

# Review metrics
curl -s http://prometheus:9090/api/v1/query?query=up

# Analyze traces
# Navigate to Jaeger UI for distributed trace analysis
```

### Recovery Procedures

#### Quantum Service Recovery
```bash
# Scale down gracefully
kubectl scale deployment quantum-engine --replicas=0 -n manifolded-quantum

# Clear quantum state (if corrupted)
kubectl delete pvc quantum-state-pvc -n manifolded-quantum

# Recreate and scale up
kubectl apply -f k8s/storage/persistent-volumes.yaml
kubectl scale deployment quantum-engine --replicas=3 -n manifolded-quantum
```

#### Database Recovery
```bash
# Restore from backup
kubectl exec -it postgres-0 -n manifolded-system -- pg_restore /backups/latest.dump

# Verify data integrity
kubectl exec -it postgres-0 -n manifolded-system -- psql -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM channels;"
```

## Security Considerations

### Network Security
- All inter-service communication uses mTLS
- Network policies enforce least-privilege access
- Ingress traffic filtered through WAF
- DDoS protection via rate limiting

### Identity & Access
- Service accounts follow principle of least privilege
- Secrets managed via external secrets operator
- RBAC policies regularly audited
- Multi-factor authentication for admin access

### Data Protection
- Encryption at rest for all persistent volumes
- Encryption in transit for all communications
- Quantum-safe cryptography for sensitive data
- Regular key rotation (90-day cycle)

### Compliance
- GDPR: Data residency and right to erasure
- SOC2: Continuous monitoring and audit logging
- HIPAA: Healthcare data protection (if applicable)
- ISO27001: Information security management

## Cost Optimization

### Resource Efficiency
- Vertical Pod Autoscaler for right-sizing
- Cluster Autoscaler for dynamic node scaling
- Spot instances for non-critical workloads
- Reserved instances for predictable workloads

### Monitoring Costs
```bash
# Check resource requests vs actual usage
kubectl describe pods -l app=economic-engine | grep -E "(Requests|Limits)"

# Monitor unused resources
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o=custom-columns="NAMESPACE:.metadata.namespace,NAME:.metadata.name,CPU_REQ:.spec.containers[*].resources.requests.cpu,MEM_REQ:.spec.containers[*].resources.requests.memory"
```

### Cost Allocation
- Resource quotas per namespace
- Cost allocation tags on all resources
- Regular cost reviews and optimization
- Budget alerts and spending controls

## Support & Maintenance

### Health Checks
Regular health verification:
```bash
# Overall cluster health
kubectl get nodes
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep -v Running

# Service health endpoints
curl -f https://api.manifolded.ai/health
curl -f https://monitoring.manifolded.ai/prometheus/-/healthy
```

### Updates & Rollbacks
```bash
# Rolling update
kubectl rollout restart deployment/quantum-engine -n manifolded-quantum

# Rollback if needed
kubectl rollout undo deployment/quantum-engine -n manifolded-quantum

# Check rollout status
kubectl rollout status deployment/quantum-engine -n manifolded-quantum
```

### Backup Procedures
- Daily automated backups of all persistent data
- Cross-region backup replication
- Quarterly disaster recovery testing
- Point-in-time recovery capability

For detailed operational procedures, see the [Operations Runbook](../docs/operations-runbook.md).

```bash
# Check rollout status
kubectl rollout status deployment/quantum-engine -n manifolded-quantum
```

### Backup Procedures
- Daily automated backups of all persistent data
- Cross-region backup replication
- Quarterly disaster recovery testing
- Point-in-time recovery capability

For detailed operational procedures, see the [Operations Runbook](../docs/operations-runbook.md).

content.text: Perfect! I've successfully completed the comprehensive Kubernetes deployment manifests for the Manifolded platform. Now let me continue with building the CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions as planned.

input.content:
name: Manifolded CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop, 'feature/**', 'hotfix/**' ]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '*.md'
      - '.gitignore'
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened ]
  release:
    types: [ published ]

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: manifolded
  RUST_VERSION: 1.75.0
  NODE_VERSION: 20.x
  ELIXIR_VERSION: 1.15.7
  OTP_VERSION: 26.1.2
  JULIA_VERSION: 1.9.4

jobs:
  # Security and Code Quality Checks
  security-scan:
    name: Security & Code Quality
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      security-events: write
      contents: read
    outputs:
      security-passed: ${{ steps.security-check.outputs.passed }}
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        scan-type: 'fs'
        scan-ref: '.'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: 'trivy-results.sarif'

    - name: Upload Trivy scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      if: always()
      with:
        sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

    - name: Run CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
      with:
        languages: rust, javascript, python

    - name: Security check summary
      id: security-check
      run: |
        if [[ -f "trivy-results.sarif" ]]; then
          CRITICAL_ISSUES=$(jq '.runs[0].results | map(select(.level == "error")) | length' trivy-results.sarif)
          echo "Critical security issues: $CRITICAL_ISSUES"
          if [[ $CRITICAL_ISSUES -gt 0 ]]; then
            echo "passed=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            exit 1
          else
            echo "passed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi
        else
          echo "passed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        fi

  # Test Suite Execution
  test-quantum-engine:
    name: Test Quantum Engine (Rust)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}
        components: rustfmt, clippy

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
      with:
        workspaces: "./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine"

    - name: Check Rust formatting
      run: cargo fmt -- --check

    - name: Run Clippy
      run: cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings

    - name: Run quantum engine tests
      run: |
        cargo test --verbose --all-features
        cargo test --release --all-features
      env:
        RUST_BACKTRACE: 1
        RUST_LOG: debug

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        cargo install cargo-tarpaulin
        cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 --out Xml --output-dir coverage/
        COVERAGE=$(cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 | grep -oP '\d+\.\d+(?=% coverage)')
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Quantum Engine Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine/coverage/cobertura.xml
        flags: quantum-engine
        name: quantum-engine-coverage

  test-economic-engine:
    name: Test Economic Engine (Rust)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: test
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: test
          POSTGRES_DB: economic_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}
        components: rustfmt, clippy

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
      with:
        workspaces: "./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine"

    - name: Check Rust formatting
      run: cargo fmt -- --check

    - name: Run Clippy
      run: cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings

    - name: Run economic engine tests
      run: |
        cargo test --verbose --all-features
        cargo test --release --all-features
      env:
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://test:test@localhost:5432/economic_test
        RUST_BACKTRACE: 1
        RUST_LOG: debug

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        cargo install cargo-tarpaulin
        cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 --out Xml --output-dir coverage/
        COVERAGE=$(cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 | grep -oP '\d+\.\d+(?=% coverage)')
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Economic Engine Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine/coverage/cobertura.xml
        flags: economic-engine
        name: economic-engine-coverage

  test-ai-consciousness:
    name: Test AI Consciousness (TypeScript)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
        cache: 'npm'
        cache-dependency-path: './specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/package-lock.json'

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci

    - name: Run TypeScript type checking
      run: npm run typecheck

    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npm run lint

    - name: Run AI consciousness tests
      run: |
        npm run test
        npm run test:integration
      env:
        NODE_ENV: test
        AI_TEST_MODE: true
        OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY_TEST }}

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        npm run test:coverage
        COVERAGE=$(jq -r '.total.lines.pct' coverage/coverage-summary.json)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "AI Consciousness Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/coverage/lcov.info
        flags: ai-consciousness
        name: ai-consciousness-coverage

  test-phoenix-dashboard:
    name: Test Phoenix Dashboard (Elixir)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: cryptobox_phoenix_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Elixir/OTP
      uses: erlef/setup-beam@v1
      with:
        elixir-version: ${{ env.ELIXIR_VERSION }}
        otp-version: ${{ env.OTP_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Elixir dependencies
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: deps
        key: ${{ runner.os }}-mix-${{ hashFiles('**/mix.lock') }}
        restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-mix-

    - name: Cache compiled build
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: _build
        key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ hashFiles('**/mix.lock') }}
        restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-build-

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: mix deps.get

    - name: Check Elixir formatting
      run: mix format --check-formatted

    - name: Run Credo static analysis
      run: mix credo --strict

    - name: Compile project
      run: mix compile --warnings-as-errors

    - name: Run Phoenix tests
      run: |
        mix test
        mix test --cover
      env:
        MIX_ENV: test
        DATABASE_URL: ecto://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/cryptobox_phoenix_test

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        mix coveralls.json
        COVERAGE=$(jq -r '.totals.coverage' cover/excoveralls.json)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Phoenix Dashboard Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy/cover/excoveralls.json
        flags: phoenix-dashboard
        name: phoenix-dashboard-coverage

  test-integration-services:
    name: Test Integration Services (Julia)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/integration
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Julia
      uses: julia-actions/setup-julia@v1
      with:
        version: ${{ env.JULIA_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Julia packages
      uses: julia-actions/cache@v1

    - name: Install Julia dependencies
      run: |
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.instantiate()'
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.test(coverage=true)'
      
    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e '
          using Pkg
          Pkg.add("Coverage")
          using Coverage
          coverage = process_folder()
          percentage = get_coverage(coverage)
          println("Integration Services Coverage: ", percentage, "%")
          open("coverage.txt", "w") do io
            println(io, percentage)
          end
        '
        COVERAGE=$(cat coverage.txt)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/integration/lcov.info
        flags: integration-services
        name: integration-services-coverage

  # Integration Tests
  integration-tests:
    name: End-to-End Integration Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test-quantum-engine, test-economic-engine, test-ai-consciousness, test-phoenix-dashboard]
    if: always() && needs.test-quantum-engine.result == 'success' && needs.test-economic-engine.result == 'success'
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./test/integration
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: manifolded_integration_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
      redis:
        image: redis:7-alpine
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "redis-cli ping"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 6379:6379
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2

    - name: Run integration tests
      run: |
        cargo test --test quantum_economic_flow
        cargo test --test ai_agent_lifecycle  
        cargo test --test cross_specialization
        cargo test --test performance
      env:
        API_BASE_URL: http://localhost:8080
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/manifolded_integration_test
        REDIS_URL: redis://localhost:6379
        RUST_LOG: debug
        TEST_TIMEOUT: 300

    - name: Generate integration test report
      run: |
        cargo test --test quantum_economic_flow -- --format json > integration-results.json
        echo "Integration test results generated"

    - name: Upload integration test results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: integration-test-results
        path: ./test/integration/integration-results.json

  # Performance Tests
  performance-tests:
    name: Performance Benchmarks
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: integration-tests
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && needs.integration-tests.result == 'success'
    outputs:
      quantum-latency: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.quantum-latency }}
      economic-tps: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.economic-tps }}
      ai-response-time: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.ai-response-time }}
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup performance testing environment
      run: |
        sudo apt-get update
        sudo apt-get install -y stress-ng htop iotop

    - name: Run quantum performance tests
      working-directory: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine
      run: |
        cargo bench --bench quantum_benchmarks > quantum-perf.txt
        cat quantum-perf.txt

    - name: Run economic performance tests  
      working-directory: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
      run: |
        cargo bench --bench payment_benchmarks > economic-perf.txt
        cat economic-perf.txt

    - name: Run AI performance tests
      working-directory: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness
      run: |
        npm run benchmark > ai-perf.txt
        cat ai-perf.txt

    - name: Extract performance metrics
      id: perf-results
      run: |
        QUANTUM_LATENCY=$(grep -oP 'key_generation.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine/quantum-perf.txt | head -1)
        ECONOMIC_TPS=$(grep -oP 'payment_throughput.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine/economic-perf.txt | head -1)
        AI_RESPONSE=$(grep -oP 'agent_response.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/ai-perf.txt | head -1)
        
        echo "quantum-latency=$QUANTUM_LATENCY" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "economic-tps=$ECONOMIC_TPS" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT  
        echo "ai-response-time=$AI_RESPONSE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        
        echo "Performance Results:"
        echo "Quantum Key Generation: ${QUANTUM_LATENCY}ms"
        echo "Economic Engine TPS: ${ECONOMIC_TPS}"
        echo "AI Response Time: ${AI_RESPONSE}s"

  # Build and Push Container Images
  build-and-push:
    name: Build & Push Container Images
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [integration-tests]
    if: needs.integration-tests.result == 'success'
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
    strategy:
      matrix:
        service: 
          - quantum-engine
          - economic-engine
          - ai-consciousness
          - phoenix-dashboard
          - quantum-economic-bridge
          - ai-economic-incentives
          - quantum-ai-consciousness
    outputs:
      image-digest: ${{ steps.build.outputs.digest }}
      image-tag: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

    - name: Log into container registry
      uses: docker/login-action@v3
      with:
        registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
        username: ${{ github.actor }}
        password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

    - name: Extract metadata
      id: meta
      uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
      with:
        images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository }}/${{ matrix.service }}
        tags: |
          type=ref,event=branch
          type=ref,event=pr
          type=semver,pattern={{version}}
          type=semver,pattern={{major}}.{{minor}}
          type=semver,pattern={{major}}
          type=sha,prefix={{branch}}-
          type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}

    - name: Build and push Docker image
      id: build
      uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
      with:
        context: .
        file: ./docker/${{ matrix.service }}/Dockerfile
        platforms: linux/amd64,linux/arm64
        push: true
        tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
        labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}
        cache-from: type=gha
        cache-to: type=gha,mode=max
        build-args: |
          VERSION=${{ steps.meta.outputs.version }}
          BUILD_DATE=${{ fromJSON(steps.meta.outputs.json).labels['org.opencontainers.image.created'] }}
          GIT_SHA=${{ github.sha }}

    - name: Generate SBOM
      uses: anchore/sbom-action@v0
      with:
        image: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository }}/${{ matrix.service }}:latest
        format: spdx-json
        output-file: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json

    - name: Upload SBOM
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom
        path: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json

  # Deploy to Development Environment
  deploy-dev:
    name: Deploy to Development
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-and-push]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' && needs.build-and-push.result == 'success'
    environment: development
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-dev-cluster

    - name: Deploy to Kubernetes
      run: |
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/dev/
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai

    - name: Run smoke tests
      run: |
        kubectl run smoke-test --image=curlimages/curl --rm -i --restart=Never -- \
          curl -f http://phoenix-dashboard.manifolded-system:4000/health
        echo "Development deployment successful!"

  # Deploy to Staging Environment
  deploy-staging:
    name: Deploy to Staging
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-and-push, performance-tests]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && needs.build-and-push.result == 'success'
    environment: staging
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-staging-cluster

    - name: Deploy to Kubernetes
      run: |
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/staging/
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai

    - name: Run comprehensive tests
      run: |
        kubectl apply -f k8s/testing/staging-tests.yaml
        kubectl wait --for=condition=complete --timeout=600s job/staging-integration-tests

    - name: Performance validation
      run: |
        echo "Validating performance metrics against targets..."
        if (( $(echo "${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }} < 1.0" | bc -l) )); then
          echo " Quantum latency within target: ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms"
        else
          echo " Quantum latency exceeded: ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms"
          exit 1
        fi

  # Production Deployment (Manual Approval Required)
  deploy-production:
    name: Deploy to Production
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [deploy-staging]
    if: github.event_name == 'release' && needs.deploy-staging.result == 'success'
    environment: production
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID_PROD }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY_PROD }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl for production
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-prod-cluster

    - name: Blue-Green deployment
      run: |
        # Deploy to green environment
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/prod/
        
        # Wait for all services to be ready
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai
        
        # Run production readiness tests
        kubectl apply -f k8s/testing/production-readiness.yaml
        kubectl wait --for=condition=complete --timeout=600s job/production-readiness-tests
        
        echo "Production deployment successful!"

    - name: Update monitoring dashboards
      run: |
        kubectl apply -f monitoring/grafana/dashboards/
        echo "Monitoring dashboards updated"

    - name: Send deployment notification
      uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
      with:
        status: success
        text: 'Manifolded platform successfully deployed to production! :rocket:'
        webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}

  # Generate Release Summary
  release-summary:
    name: Generate Release Summary
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test-quantum-engine, test-economic-engine, test-ai-consciousness, test-phoenix-dashboard, integration-tests, performance-tests]
    if: always()
    steps:
    - name: Generate summary
      run: |
        echo "# Manifolded Platform CI/CD Summary" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "## Test Results" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Component | Coverage | Status |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "|-----------|----------|---------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Quantum Engine | ${{ needs.test-quantum-engine.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-quantum-engine.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Economic Engine | ${{ needs.test-economic-engine.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-economic-engine.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| AI Consciousness | ${{ needs.test-ai-consciousness.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-ai-consciousness.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Phoenix Dashboard | ${{ needs.test-phoenix-dashboard.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-phoenix-dashboard.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "## Performance Metrics" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Metric | Value | Target | Status |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "|--------|-------|---------|---------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Quantum Key Generation | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms | <1ms | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency < '1.0' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Economic Engine TPS | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.economic-tps }} | >10,000 | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.economic-tps > '10000' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| AI Response Time | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.ai-response-time }}s | <30s | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.ai-response-time < '30' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
