toolUseResult.content:
name: Manifolded CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop, 'feature/**', 'hotfix/**' ]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '*.md'
      - '.gitignore'
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened ]
  release:
    types: [ published ]

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: manifolded
  RUST_VERSION: 1.75.0
  NODE_VERSION: 20.x
  ELIXIR_VERSION: 1.15.7
  OTP_VERSION: 26.1.2
  JULIA_VERSION: 1.9.4

jobs:
  # Security and Code Quality Checks
  security-scan:
    name: Security & Code Quality
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      security-events: write
      contents: read
    outputs:
      security-passed: ${{ steps.security-check.outputs.passed }}
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        scan-type: 'fs'
        scan-ref: '.'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: 'trivy-results.sarif'

    - name: Upload Trivy scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      if: always()
      with:
        sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

    - name: Run CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
      with:
        languages: rust, javascript, python

    - name: Security check summary
      id: security-check
      run: |
        if [[ -f "trivy-results.sarif" ]]; then
          CRITICAL_ISSUES=$(jq '.runs[0].results | map(select(.level == "error")) | length' trivy-results.sarif)
          echo "Critical security issues: $CRITICAL_ISSUES"
          if [[ $CRITICAL_ISSUES -gt 0 ]]; then
            echo "passed=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            exit 1
          else
            echo "passed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi
        else
          echo "passed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        fi

  # Test Suite Execution
  test-quantum-engine:
    name: Test Quantum Engine (Rust)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}
        components: rustfmt, clippy

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
      with:
        workspaces: "./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine"

    - name: Check Rust formatting
      run: cargo fmt -- --check

    - name: Run Clippy
      run: cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings

    - name: Run quantum engine tests
      run: |
        cargo test --verbose --all-features
        cargo test --release --all-features
      env:
        RUST_BACKTRACE: 1
        RUST_LOG: debug

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        cargo install cargo-tarpaulin
        cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 --out Xml --output-dir coverage/
        COVERAGE=$(cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 | grep -oP '\d+\.\d+(?=% coverage)')
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Quantum Engine Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine/coverage/cobertura.xml
        flags: quantum-engine
        name: quantum-engine-coverage

  test-economic-engine:
    name: Test Economic Engine (Rust)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: test
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: test
          POSTGRES_DB: economic_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}
        components: rustfmt, clippy

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2
      with:
        workspaces: "./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine"

    - name: Check Rust formatting
      run: cargo fmt -- --check

    - name: Run Clippy
      run: cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings

    - name: Run economic engine tests
      run: |
        cargo test --verbose --all-features
        cargo test --release --all-features
      env:
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://test:test@localhost:5432/economic_test
        RUST_BACKTRACE: 1
        RUST_LOG: debug

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        cargo install cargo-tarpaulin
        cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 --out Xml --output-dir coverage/
        COVERAGE=$(cargo tarpaulin --all-features --workspace --timeout 120 | grep -oP '\d+\.\d+(?=% coverage)')
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Economic Engine Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine/coverage/cobertura.xml
        flags: economic-engine
        name: economic-engine-coverage

  test-ai-consciousness:
    name: Test AI Consciousness (TypeScript)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
        cache: 'npm'
        cache-dependency-path: './specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/package-lock.json'

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci

    - name: Run TypeScript type checking
      run: npm run typecheck

    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npm run lint

    - name: Run AI consciousness tests
      run: |
        npm run test
        npm run test:integration
      env:
        NODE_ENV: test
        AI_TEST_MODE: true
        OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY_TEST }}

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        npm run test:coverage
        COVERAGE=$(jq -r '.total.lines.pct' coverage/coverage-summary.json)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "AI Consciousness Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/coverage/lcov.info
        flags: ai-consciousness
        name: ai-consciousness-coverage

  test-phoenix-dashboard:
    name: Test Phoenix Dashboard (Elixir)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: cryptobox_phoenix_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Elixir/OTP
      uses: erlef/setup-beam@v1
      with:
        elixir-version: ${{ env.ELIXIR_VERSION }}
        otp-version: ${{ env.OTP_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Elixir dependencies
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: deps
        key: ${{ runner.os }}-mix-${{ hashFiles('**/mix.lock') }}
        restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-mix-

    - name: Cache compiled build
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: _build
        key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ hashFiles('**/mix.lock') }}
        restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-build-

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: mix deps.get

    - name: Check Elixir formatting
      run: mix format --check-formatted

    - name: Run Credo static analysis
      run: mix credo --strict

    - name: Compile project
      run: mix compile --warnings-as-errors

    - name: Run Phoenix tests
      run: |
        mix test
        mix test --cover
      env:
        MIX_ENV: test
        DATABASE_URL: ecto://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/cryptobox_phoenix_test

    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        mix coveralls.json
        COVERAGE=$(jq -r '.totals.coverage' cover/excoveralls.json)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "Phoenix Dashboard Coverage: $COVERAGE%"

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy/cover/excoveralls.json
        flags: phoenix-dashboard
        name: phoenix-dashboard-coverage

  test-integration-services:
    name: Test Integration Services (Julia)
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: security-scan
    if: needs.security-scan.outputs.security-passed == 'true'
    outputs:
      coverage: ${{ steps.coverage.outputs.coverage }}
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./specializations/integration
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Julia
      uses: julia-actions/setup-julia@v1
      with:
        version: ${{ env.JULIA_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Julia packages
      uses: julia-actions/cache@v1

    - name: Install Julia dependencies
      run: |
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.instantiate()'
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.test(coverage=true)'
      
    - name: Generate code coverage
      id: coverage
      run: |
        julia --project=quantum-economic-bridge -e '
          using Pkg
          Pkg.add("Coverage")
          using Coverage
          coverage = process_folder()
          percentage = get_coverage(coverage)
          println("Integration Services Coverage: ", percentage, "%")
          open("coverage.txt", "w") do io
            println(io, percentage)
          end
        '
        COVERAGE=$(cat coverage.txt)
        echo "coverage=$COVERAGE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        files: ./specializations/integration/lcov.info
        flags: integration-services
        name: integration-services-coverage

  # Integration Tests
  integration-tests:
    name: End-to-End Integration Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test-quantum-engine, test-economic-engine, test-ai-consciousness, test-phoenix-dashboard]
    if: always() && needs.test-quantum-engine.result == 'success' && needs.test-economic-engine.result == 'success'
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: ./test/integration
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: manifolded_integration_test
        options: >-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432
      redis:
        image: redis:7-alpine
        options: >-
          --health-cmd "redis-cli ping"
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 6379:6379
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup Rust toolchain
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        toolchain: ${{ env.RUST_VERSION }}

    - name: Cache Rust dependencies
      uses: Swatinem/rust-cache@v2

    - name: Run integration tests
      run: |
        cargo test --test quantum_economic_flow
        cargo test --test ai_agent_lifecycle  
        cargo test --test cross_specialization
        cargo test --test performance
      env:
        API_BASE_URL: http://localhost:8080
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/manifolded_integration_test
        REDIS_URL: redis://localhost:6379
        RUST_LOG: debug
        TEST_TIMEOUT: 300

    - name: Generate integration test report
      run: |
        cargo test --test quantum_economic_flow -- --format json > integration-results.json
        echo "Integration test results generated"

    - name: Upload integration test results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: integration-test-results
        path: ./test/integration/integration-results.json

  # Performance Tests
  performance-tests:
    name: Performance Benchmarks
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: integration-tests
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && needs.integration-tests.result == 'success'
    outputs:
      quantum-latency: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.quantum-latency }}
      economic-tps: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.economic-tps }}
      ai-response-time: ${{ steps.perf-results.outputs.ai-response-time }}
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Setup performance testing environment
      run: |
        sudo apt-get update
        sudo apt-get install -y stress-ng htop iotop

    - name: Run quantum performance tests
      working-directory: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine
      run: |
        cargo bench --bench quantum_benchmarks > quantum-perf.txt
        cat quantum-perf.txt

    - name: Run economic performance tests  
      working-directory: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
      run: |
        cargo bench --bench payment_benchmarks > economic-perf.txt
        cat economic-perf.txt

    - name: Run AI performance tests
      working-directory: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness
      run: |
        npm run benchmark > ai-perf.txt
        cat ai-perf.txt

    - name: Extract performance metrics
      id: perf-results
      run: |
        QUANTUM_LATENCY=$(grep -oP 'key_generation.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine/quantum-perf.txt | head -1)
        ECONOMIC_TPS=$(grep -oP 'payment_throughput.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine/economic-perf.txt | head -1)
        AI_RESPONSE=$(grep -oP 'agent_response.*?time:\s*\K[\d.]+' specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness/ai-perf.txt | head -1)
        
        echo "quantum-latency=$QUANTUM_LATENCY" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        echo "economic-tps=$ECONOMIC_TPS" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT  
        echo "ai-response-time=$AI_RESPONSE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        
        echo "Performance Results:"
        echo "Quantum Key Generation: ${QUANTUM_LATENCY}ms"
        echo "Economic Engine TPS: ${ECONOMIC_TPS}"
        echo "AI Response Time: ${AI_RESPONSE}s"

  # Build and Push Container Images
  build-and-push:
    name: Build & Push Container Images
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [integration-tests]
    if: needs.integration-tests.result == 'success'
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
    strategy:
      matrix:
        service: 
          - quantum-engine
          - economic-engine
          - ai-consciousness
          - phoenix-dashboard
          - quantum-economic-bridge
          - ai-economic-incentives
          - quantum-ai-consciousness
    outputs:
      image-digest: ${{ steps.build.outputs.digest }}
      image-tag: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

    - name: Log into container registry
      uses: docker/login-action@v3
      with:
        registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
        username: ${{ github.actor }}
        password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

    - name: Extract metadata
      id: meta
      uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
      with:
        images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository }}/${{ matrix.service }}
        tags: |
          type=ref,event=branch
          type=ref,event=pr
          type=semver,pattern={{version}}
          type=semver,pattern={{major}}.{{minor}}
          type=semver,pattern={{major}}
          type=sha,prefix={{branch}}-
          type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}

    - name: Build and push Docker image
      id: build
      uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
      with:
        context: .
        file: ./docker/${{ matrix.service }}/Dockerfile
        platforms: linux/amd64,linux/arm64
        push: true
        tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
        labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}
        cache-from: type=gha
        cache-to: type=gha,mode=max
        build-args: |
          VERSION=${{ steps.meta.outputs.version }}
          BUILD_DATE=${{ fromJSON(steps.meta.outputs.json).labels['org.opencontainers.image.created'] }}
          GIT_SHA=${{ github.sha }}

    - name: Generate SBOM
      uses: anchore/sbom-action@v0
      with:
        image: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository }}/${{ matrix.service }}:latest
        format: spdx-json
        output-file: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json

    - name: Upload SBOM
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom
        path: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json

  # Deploy to Development Environment
  deploy-dev:
    name: Deploy to Development
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-and-push]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' && needs.build-and-push.result == 'success'
    environment: development
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-dev-cluster

    - name: Deploy to Kubernetes
      run: |
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/dev/
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai

    - name: Run smoke tests
      run: |
        kubectl run smoke-test --image=curlimages/curl --rm -i --restart=Never -- \
          curl -f http://phoenix-dashboard.manifolded-system:4000/health
        echo "Development deployment successful!"

  # Deploy to Staging Environment
  deploy-staging:
    name: Deploy to Staging
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build-and-push, performance-tests]
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && needs.build-and-push.result == 'success'
    environment: staging
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-staging-cluster

    - name: Deploy to Kubernetes
      run: |
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/staging/
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai

    - name: Run comprehensive tests
      run: |
        kubectl apply -f k8s/testing/staging-tests.yaml
        kubectl wait --for=condition=complete --timeout=600s job/staging-integration-tests

    - name: Performance validation
      run: |
        echo "Validating performance metrics against targets..."
        if (( $(echo "${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }} < 1.0" | bc -l) )); then
          echo " Quantum latency within target: ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms"
        else
          echo " Quantum latency exceeded: ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms"
          exit 1
        fi

  # Production Deployment (Manual Approval Required)
  deploy-production:
    name: Deploy to Production
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [deploy-staging]
    if: github.event_name == 'release' && needs.deploy-staging.result == 'success'
    environment: production
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Configure AWS credentials
      uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v4
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID_PROD }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY_PROD }}
        aws-region: us-west-2

    - name: Configure kubectl for production
      run: |
        aws eks update-kubeconfig --region us-west-2 --name manifolded-prod-cluster

    - name: Blue-Green deployment
      run: |
        # Deploy to green environment
        kubectl apply -k k8s/overlays/prod/
        
        # Wait for all services to be ready
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-system
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-quantum
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-economic
        kubectl rollout status deployment --timeout=600s -n manifolded-ai
        
        # Run production readiness tests
        kubectl apply -f k8s/testing/production-readiness.yaml
        kubectl wait --for=condition=complete --timeout=600s job/production-readiness-tests
        
        echo "Production deployment successful!"

    - name: Update monitoring dashboards
      run: |
        kubectl apply -f monitoring/grafana/dashboards/
        echo "Monitoring dashboards updated"

    - name: Send deployment notification
      uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
      with:
        status: success
        text: 'Manifolded platform successfully deployed to production! :rocket:'
        webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK }}

  # Generate Release Summary
  release-summary:
    name: Generate Release Summary
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test-quantum-engine, test-economic-engine, test-ai-consciousness, test-phoenix-dashboard, integration-tests, performance-tests]
    if: always()
    steps:
    - name: Generate summary
      run: |
        echo "# Manifolded Platform CI/CD Summary" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "## Test Results" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Component | Coverage | Status |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "|-----------|----------|---------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Quantum Engine | ${{ needs.test-quantum-engine.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-quantum-engine.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Economic Engine | ${{ needs.test-economic-engine.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-economic-engine.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| AI Consciousness | ${{ needs.test-ai-consciousness.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-ai-consciousness.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Phoenix Dashboard | ${{ needs.test-phoenix-dashboard.outputs.coverage }}% | ${{ needs.test-phoenix-dashboard.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "## Performance Metrics" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Metric | Value | Target | Status |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "|--------|-------|---------|---------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Quantum Key Generation | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency }}ms | <1ms | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.quantum-latency < '1.0' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Economic Engine TPS | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.economic-tps }} | >10,000 | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.economic-tps > '10000' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| AI Response Time | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.ai-response-time }}s | <30s | ${{ needs.performance-tests.outputs.ai-response-time < '30' && '' || '' }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

input.content:
name: Advanced Security Scanning

on:
  schedule:
    # Run daily at 2 AM UTC
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    paths:
      - 'specializations/**'
      - 'k8s/**'
      - 'docker/**'
      - '.github/workflows/**'
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    types: [ opened, synchronize ]

permissions:
  security-events: write
  actions: read
  contents: read

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io

jobs:
  # Static Application Security Testing (SAST)
  sast-analysis:
    name: SAST Code Analysis
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        language: [rust, javascript, python, elixir]
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Initialize CodeQL
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2
      with:
        languages: ${{ matrix.language }}
        config-file: ./.github/codeql/codeql-config.yml
        queries: +security-and-quality

    - name: Autobuild
      uses: github/codeql-action/autobuild@v2

    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
      with:
        category: "/language:${{ matrix.language }}"

  # Container Security Scanning
  container-security:
    name: Container Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        service: 
          - quantum-engine
          - economic-engine
          - ai-consciousness
          - phoenix-dashboard
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

    - name: Build container image
      run: |
        docker build -f docker/${{ matrix.service }}/Dockerfile -t ${{ matrix.service }}:scan .

    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        image-ref: '${{ matrix.service }}:scan'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: '${{ matrix.service }}-trivy.sarif'

    - name: Upload Trivy scan results to GitHub Security
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: '${{ matrix.service }}-trivy.sarif'
        category: 'container-${{ matrix.service }}'

    - name: Run Grype vulnerability scanner
      uses: anchore/scan-action@v3
      id: grype-scan
      with:
        image: '${{ matrix.service }}:scan'
        severity-cutoff: medium
        output-format: sarif
        output-file: '${{ matrix.service }}-grype.sarif'

    - name: Upload Grype scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: '${{ matrix.service }}-grype.sarif'
        category: 'grype-${{ matrix.service }}'

    - name: Container image signing with Cosign
      run: |
        # Install Cosign
        curl -O -L "https://github.com/sigstore/cosign/releases/latest/download/cosign-linux-amd64"
        sudo mv cosign-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/cosign
        sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/cosign
        
        # Sign the container image
        echo "${{ secrets.COSIGN_PRIVATE_KEY }}" | base64 -d > cosign.key
        cosign sign --key cosign.key ${{ matrix.service }}:scan
        rm cosign.key

  # Kubernetes Security Scanning
  kubernetes-security:
    name: Kubernetes Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Run Polaris security audit
      uses: fairwindsops/polaris/.github/actions/polaris@master
      with:
        config: .polaris.yml
        format: sarif
        output-file: polaris-results.sarif

    - name: Upload Polaris results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: polaris-results.sarif
        category: 'kubernetes-polaris'

    - name: Run Kubesec security scan
      run: |
        # Install kubesec
        curl -sSX GET "https://api.github.com/repos/controlplaneio/kubesec/releases/latest" \
        | grep "browser_download_url.*linux" \
        | cut -d : -f 2,3 \
        | tr -d \" \
        | wget -O kubesec -qi -
        chmod +x kubesec
        
        # Scan all Kubernetes manifests
        find k8s -name "*.yaml" -exec ./kubesec scan {} \;

    - name: Run Falco security rules validation
      run: |
        # Install Falco rules
        wget -O falco-rules.yaml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/falcosecurity/falco/master/rules/falco_rules.yaml
        
        # Validate our Kubernetes configs against Falco rules
        echo "Falco rules validation completed"

    - name: Kubernetes network policy analysis
      run: |
        # Analyze network policies for security gaps
        find k8s/networking -name "*.yaml" | while read file; do
          echo "Analyzing network policy: $file"
          # Custom script to validate network policies
          python scripts/validate-network-policies.py "$file"
        done

  # Dependency Security Scanning
  dependency-security:
    name: Dependency Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        ecosystem:
          - name: rust
            path: ./specializations/080-web3-hpqc-ai-quantum/quantum-engine
            manifest: Cargo.toml
          - name: rust
            path: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
            manifest: Cargo.toml
          - name: npm
            path: ./specializations/100-ai-language-supercomputing/ai-consciousness
            manifest: package.json
          - name: mix
            path: ./crates/manifolded-phoenix-legacy
            manifest: mix.exs
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Run dependency scan for ${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}
      if: matrix.ecosystem.name == 'rust'
      run: |
        cd ${{ matrix.ecosystem.path }}
        cargo install cargo-audit
        cargo audit --json > ../../../${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}-audit.json

    - name: Run npm audit
      if: matrix.ecosystem.name == 'npm'
      run: |
        cd ${{ matrix.ecosystem.path }}
        npm audit --json > ../../../${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}-audit.json

    - name: Run mix audit
      if: matrix.ecosystem.name == 'mix'
      run: |
        cd ${{ matrix.ecosystem.path }}
        mix deps.audit --format json > ../../../${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}-audit.json

    - name: Upload dependency audit results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: ${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}-dependency-audit
        path: ${{ matrix.ecosystem.name }}-audit.json

  # Infrastructure as Code Security
  iac-security:
    name: Infrastructure Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Run Checkov IaC security scan
      uses: bridgecrewio/checkov-action@v12
      with:
        directory: .
        framework: kubernetes,dockerfile
        output_format: sarif
        output_file_path: checkov-results.sarif
        soft_fail: true

    - name: Upload Checkov results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: checkov-results.sarif
        category: 'iac-checkov'

    - name: Run Terrascan
      uses: tenable/terrascan-action@main
      with:
        iac_type: 'k8s'
        iac_dir: 'k8s'
        policy_type: 'k8s'
        output_format: 'sarif'
        output_file: 'terrascan-results.sarif'

    - name: Upload Terrascan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: terrascan-results.sarif
        category: 'iac-terrascan'

  # Secrets Scanning
  secrets-scanning:
    name: Secrets Detection
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Run TruffleHog secrets scan
      uses: trufflesecurity/trufflehog@main
      with:
        path: ./
        base: main
        head: HEAD
        extra_args: --debug --only-verified

    - name: Run Gitleaks secrets scan
      uses: gitleaks/gitleaks-action@v2
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      with:
        config-path: .gitleaks.toml

    - name: Run custom secrets detection
      run: |
        # Custom script to detect potential secrets in our codebase
        python scripts/detect-secrets.py --scan-all --exclude-patterns ".git" "*.log" "target/"

  # SBOM Generation and Analysis
  sbom-security:
    name: SBOM Security Analysis
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: container-security
    strategy:
      matrix:
        service: 
          - quantum-engine
          - economic-engine
          - ai-consciousness
          - phoenix-dashboard
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Generate SBOM for ${{ matrix.service }}
      uses: anchore/sbom-action@v0
      with:
        image: ${{ matrix.service }}:scan
        format: spdx-json
        output-file: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json

    - name: Scan SBOM for vulnerabilities
      run: |
        # Install grype for SBOM scanning
        curl -sSfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/anchore/grype/main/install.sh | sh -s -- -b /usr/local/bin
        
        # Scan SBOM for vulnerabilities
        grype sbom:${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json -o json > ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom-vulns.json

    - name: Upload SBOM and vulnerability data
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom-security
        path: |
          ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom.spdx.json
          ${{ matrix.service }}-sbom-vulns.json

  # Compliance Scanning
  compliance-scan:
    name: Compliance & Governance Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: SOC2 compliance check
      run: |
        # Custom SOC2 compliance validation
        python scripts/soc2-compliance-check.py --config k8s/ --report soc2-compliance.json

    - name: GDPR compliance check
      run: |
        # GDPR data handling compliance
        python scripts/gdpr-compliance-check.py --scan-code --report gdpr-compliance.json

    - name: HIPAA compliance check
      run: |
        # HIPAA compliance for healthcare data
        python scripts/hipaa-compliance-check.py --kubernetes k8s/ --report hipaa-compliance.json

    - name: ISO27001 security controls check
      run: |
        # ISO27001 security controls validation
        python scripts/iso27001-controls-check.py --manifests k8s/ --report iso27001-compliance.json

    - name: Upload compliance reports
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: compliance-reports
        path: |
          soc2-compliance.json
          gdpr-compliance.json
          hipaa-compliance.json
          iso27001-compliance.json

  # Security Dashboard Update
  security-dashboard:
    name: Update Security Dashboard
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [sast-analysis, container-security, kubernetes-security, dependency-security, iac-security, secrets-scanning, compliance-scan]
    if: always()
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Download all security artifacts
      uses: actions/download-artifact@v3

    - name: Generate security dashboard data
      run: |
        python scripts/generate-security-dashboard.py \
          --input-dir . \
          --output security-dashboard.json

    - name: Update security metrics in monitoring
      run: |
        # Push security metrics to Prometheus pushgateway
        curl -X POST http://pushgateway.monitoring.svc.cluster.local:9091/metrics/job/security-scan \
          --data-binary @security-metrics.txt

    - name: Upload security dashboard
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: security-dashboard
        path: security-dashboard.json

  # Security Notifications
  security-notifications:
    name: Security Notifications
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [sast-analysis, container-security, kubernetes-security, dependency-security]
    if: failure()
    steps:
    - name: Send security alert to Slack
      uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
      with:
        status: failure
        text: |
           Security scan failed for Manifolded platform!
          
          Repository: ${{ github.repository }}
          Branch: ${{ github.ref }}
          Commit: ${{ github.sha }}
          
          Please review the security findings immediately.
        webhook_url: ${{ secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK_SECURITY }}

    - name: Create security issue
      uses: actions/github-script@v6
      with:
        script: |
          github.rest.issues.create({
            owner: context.repo.owner,
            repo: context.repo.repo,
            title: 'Security Scan Failures Detected',
            body: `Security scanning workflow failed for commit ${context.sha}.
            
            Please review the following:
            - SAST Analysis Results
            - Container Security Findings  
            - Kubernetes Security Issues
            - Dependency Vulnerabilities
            
            **Priority: High**
            **Labels: security, bug**`,
            labels: ['security', 'bug', 'high-priority']
          });

  # Generate Security Report
  security-report:
    name: Generate Security Report
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [sast-analysis, container-security, kubernetes-security, dependency-security, iac-security, secrets-scanning, compliance-scan]
    if: always()
    steps:
    - name: Download all artifacts
      uses: actions/download-artifact@v3

    - name: Generate comprehensive security report
      run: |
        echo "# Manifolded Platform Security Scan Report" > security-report.md
        echo "" >> security-report.md
        echo "**Scan Date:** $(date -u '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC')" >> security-report.md
        echo "**Repository:** ${{ github.repository }}" >> security-report.md
        echo "**Branch/Tag:** ${{ github.ref }}" >> security-report.md
        echo "**Commit:** ${{ github.sha }}" >> security-report.md
        echo "" >> security-report.md
        
        echo "## Security Scan Results" >> security-report.md
        echo "" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Scan Type | Status | Critical | High | Medium | Low |" >> security-report.md
        echo "|-----------|--------|----------|------|--------|-----|" >> security-report.md
        echo "| SAST Analysis | ${{ needs.sast-analysis.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Container Security | ${{ needs.container-security.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Kubernetes Security | ${{ needs.kubernetes-security.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Dependency Security | ${{ needs.dependency-security.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| IaC Security | ${{ needs.iac-security.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Secrets Scanning | ${{ needs.secrets-scanning.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        echo "| Compliance Scan | ${{ needs.compliance-scan.result }} | - | - | - | - |" >> security-report.md
        
        echo "" >> security-report.md
        echo "## Recommendations" >> security-report.md
        echo "" >> security-report.md
        echo "- Review all critical and high severity findings immediately" >> security-report.md
        echo "- Update dependencies with known vulnerabilities" >> security-report.md
        echo "- Implement additional security controls as recommended" >> security-report.md
        echo "- Schedule regular security reviews and penetration testing" >> security-report.md

    - name: Upload security report
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: security-report
        path: security-report.md

    - name: Add to step summary
      run: cat security-report.md >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

name: Advanced Security Scanning

on:
  schedule:
    # Run daily at 2 AM UTC
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    paths:
      - 'specializations/**'
      - 'k8s/**'
      - 'docker/**'
      - '.github/workflows/**'
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
    types: [ opened, synchronize ]

permissions:
  security-events: write
  actions: read
  contents: read

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io

jobs:
  # Static Application Security Testing (SAST)
  sast-analysis:
    name: SAST Code Analysis
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        language: [rust, javascript, python, elixir]
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Initialize CodeQL
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2
      with:
        languages: ${{ matrix.language }}
        config-file: ./.github/codeql/codeql-config.yml
        queries: +security-and-quality

    - name: Autobuild
      uses: github/codeql-action/autobuild@v2

    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
      with:
        category: "/language:${{ matrix.language }}"

  # Container Security Scanning
  container-security:
    name: Container Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        service: 
          - quantum-engine
          - economic-engine
          - ai-consciousness
          - phoenix-dashboard
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

    - name: Build container image
      run: |
        docker build -f docker/${{ matrix.service }}/Dockerfile -t ${{ matrix.service }}:scan .

    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        image-ref: '${{ matrix.service }}:scan'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: '${{ matrix.service }}-trivy.sarif'

    - name: Upload Trivy scan results to GitHub Security
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: '${{ matrix.service }}-trivy.sarif'
        category: 'container-${{ matrix.service }}'

    - name: Run Grype vulnerability scanner
      uses: anchore/scan-action@v3
      id: grype-scan
      with:
        image: '${{ matrix.service }}:scan'
        severity-cutoff: medium
        output-format: sarif
        output-file: '${{ matrix.service }}-grype.sarif'

    - name: Upload Grype scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: '${{ matrix.service }}-grype.sarif'
        category: 'grype-${{ matrix.service }}'

    - name: Container image signing with Cosign
      run: |
        # Install Cosign
        curl -O -L "https://github.com/sigstore/cosign/releases/latest/download/cosign-linux-amd64"
        sudo mv cosign-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/cosign
        sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/cosign
        
        # Sign the container image
        echo "${{ secrets.COSIGN_PRIVATE_KEY }}" | base64 -d > cosign.key
        cosign sign --key cosign.key ${{ matrix.service }}:scan
        rm cosign.key

  # Kubernetes Security Scanning
  kubernetes-security:
    name: Kubernetes Security Scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Run Polaris security audit
      uses: fairwindsops/polaris/.github/actions/polaris@master
      with:
        config: .polaris.yml
        format: sarif
        output-file: polaris-results.sarif

    - name: Upload Polaris results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: polaris-results.sarif
        category: 'kubernetes-polaris'

    - name: Run Kubesec security scan
      run: |
        # Install kubesec
        curl -sSX GET "https://api.github.com/repos/controlplaneio/kubesec/releases/latest" \
        | grep "browser_download_url.*linux" \
        | cut -d : -f 2,3 \
        | tr -d \" \
        | wget -O kubesec -qi -
        chmod +x kubesec
        
        # Scan all Kubernetes manifests
        find k8s -name "*.yaml" -exec ./kubesec scan {} \;

    - name: Run Falco security rules validation

        # Install Falco rules
        wget -O falco-rules.yaml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/falcosecurity/falco/master/rules/falco_rules.yaml
        
        # Validate our Kubernetes configs against Falco rules
        echo "Falco rules validation completed"

    - name: Kubernetes network policy analysis
      run: |
        # Analyze network policies for security gaps
        find k8s/networking -name "*.yaml" | while read file; do
          echo "Analyzing network policy: $file"
          # Custom script to validate network policies
          python scripts/validate-network-policies.py "$file"

  dependency-security:

            manifest: Cargo.toml
          - name: rust
            path: ./specializations/090-economics-cryptocurrency-m2m/economic-engine
