input.content:
{{- if .Values.tracing.enabled }}
# OpenTelemetry Collector for comprehensive telemetry collection
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
    manifolded.ai/observability: telemetry
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      {{- include "manifolded.selectorLabels" . | nindent 6 }}
      app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 8 }}
        app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
        manifolded.ai/observability: telemetry
    spec:
      securityContext:
        {{- include "manifolded.podSecurityContext" . | nindent 8 }}
      serviceAccountName: opentelemetry-collector
      containers:
      - name: opentelemetry-collector
        image: otel/opentelemetry-collector-contrib:0.91.0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        command:
        - /otelcol-contrib
        - --config=/conf/otel-collector-config.yaml
        ports:
        # OTLP receivers
        - containerPort: 4317
          name: otlp-grpc
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 4318
          name: otlp-http
          protocol: TCP
        # Jaeger receivers
        - containerPort: 14250
          name: jaeger-grpc
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 14268
          name: jaeger-thrift
          protocol: TCP
        # Zipkin receiver
        - containerPort: 9411
          name: zipkin
          protocol: TCP
        # Prometheus metrics
        - containerPort: 8888
          name: metrics
          protocol: TCP
        # Health check
        - containerPort: 13133
          name: health-check
          protocol: TCP
        env:
        - name: MY_POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: GOMEMLIMIT
          value: "512MiB"
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 200m
            memory: 256Mi
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 512Mi
        securityContext:
          {{- include "manifolded.securityContext" . | nindent 10 }}
        volumeMounts:
        - name: otel-collector-config
          mountPath: /conf
          readOnly: true
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: health-check
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          periodSeconds: 10
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /
            port: health-check
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 5
      volumes:
      - name: otel-collector-config
        configMap:
          name: opentelemetry-collector-config
---
# OpenTelemetry Collector Service
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
  annotations:
    prometheus.io/scrape: "true"
    prometheus.io/port: "8888"
    prometheus.io/path: "/metrics"
spec:
  type: ClusterIP
  ports:
  - port: 4317
    targetPort: otlp-grpc
    protocol: TCP
    name: otlp-grpc
  - port: 4318
    targetPort: otlp-http
    protocol: TCP
    name: otlp-http
  - port: 14250
    targetPort: jaeger-grpc
    protocol: TCP
    name: jaeger-grpc
  - port: 14268
    targetPort: jaeger-thrift
    protocol: TCP
    name: jaeger-thrift
  - port: 9411
    targetPort: zipkin
    protocol: TCP
    name: zipkin
  - port: 8888
    targetPort: metrics
    protocol: TCP
    name: metrics
  selector:
    {{- include "manifolded.selectorLabels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
---
# OpenTelemetry Collector ServiceAccount
apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
automountServiceAccountToken: true
---
# ClusterRole for OpenTelemetry Collector
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources: ["pods", "namespaces", "nodes", "services", "endpoints"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
- apiGroups: ["apps"]
  resources: ["replicasets"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
- apiGroups: ["extensions"]
  resources: ["replicasets"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
---
# ClusterRoleBinding for OpenTelemetry Collector
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: opentelemetry-collector
subjects:
- kind: ServiceAccount
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
---
# OpenTelemetry Collector Configuration
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector-config
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector-config
data:
  otel-collector-config.yaml: |
    receivers:
      # OTLP receivers for direct OpenTelemetry protocol
      otlp:
        protocols:
          grpc:
            endpoint: 0.0.0.0:4317
          http:
            endpoint: 0.0.0.0:4318
      
      # Jaeger receivers for legacy Jaeger instrumentation
      jaeger:
        protocols:
          grpc:
            endpoint: 0.0.0.0:14250
          thrift_http:
            endpoint: 0.0.0.0:14268
      
      # Zipkin receiver for Zipkin-compatible traces
      zipkin:
        endpoint: 0.0.0.0:9411
      
      # Prometheus receiver for metrics collection
      prometheus:
        config:
          scrape_configs:
          - job_name: 'opentelemetry-collector'
            scrape_interval: 10s
            static_configs:
            - targets: ['0.0.0.0:8888']
      
      # Kubernetes cluster receiver for infrastructure metrics
      k8s_cluster:
        auth_type: serviceAccount
        node_conditions_to_report: [Ready, MemoryPressure, DiskPressure, PIDPressure]
        distribution: kubernetes
        
      # Host metrics receiver for node-level metrics
      hostmetrics:
        collection_interval: 10s
        scrapers:
          cpu:
            metrics:
              system.cpu.utilization:
                enabled: true
          memory:
            metrics:
              system.memory.utilization:
                enabled: true
          filesystem:
            metrics:
              system.filesystem.utilization:
                enabled: true
          network:
          process:
          
    processors:
      # Batch processor for efficient data transmission
      batch:
        timeout: 1s
        send_batch_size: 1024
        send_batch_max_size: 2048
        
      # Memory limiter to prevent OOM
      memory_limiter:
        limit_mib: 400
        spike_limit_mib: 100
        check_interval: 5s
        
      # Resource processor to add Kubernetes metadata
      resource:
        attributes:
        - key: environment
          value: {{ .Values.global.environment }}
          action: insert
        - key: cluster
          from_attribute: k8s.cluster.name
          action: insert
        - key: namespace
          from_attribute: k8s.namespace.name
          action: insert
        - key: pod
          from_attribute: k8s.pod.name
          action: insert
        - key: service
          from_attribute: k8s.deployment.name
          action: insert
          
      # Attributes processor for enriching telemetry data
      attributes:
        actions:
        - key: manifolded.version
          value: "{{ .Chart.AppVersion }}"
          action: insert
        - key: manifolded.specialization
          from_attribute: manifolded.ai/specialization
          action: insert
        - key: manifolded.tier
          from_attribute: manifolded.ai/tier
          action: insert
          
      # Probabilistic sampling for trace volume control
      probabilistic_sampler:
        sampling_percentage: 10.0
        
      # Span processor for trace enrichment
      span:
        name:
          to_attributes:
            rules:
            - ^(.*)$
              
    exporters:
      # Jaeger exporter for trace data
      jaeger:
        endpoint: jaeger-collector.{{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}.svc.cluster.local:14250
        tls:
          insecure: true
          
      # Prometheus exporter for metrics
      prometheus:
        endpoint: "0.0.0.0:8888"
        const_labels:
          environment: {{ .Values.global.environment }}
          cluster: {{ .Release.Name }}
          
      # Logging exporter for debugging
      logging:
        loglevel: info
        sampling_initial: 2
        sampling_thereafter: 500
        
      # OTLP exporter for additional backends (if configured)
      otlp/jaeger:
        endpoint: jaeger-collector.{{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}.svc.cluster.local:14250
        tls:
          insecure: true
          
    extensions:
      # Health check extension
      health_check:
        endpoint: 0.0.0.0:13133
        
      # Performance profiler
      pprof:
        endpoint: 0.0.0.0:1777
        
      # Memory ballast for GC optimization
      memory_ballast:
        size_mib: 165
        
    service:
      extensions: [health_check, pprof, memory_ballast]
      pipelines:
        # Traces pipeline
        traces:
          receivers: [otlp, jaeger, zipkin]
          processors: [memory_limiter, batch, resource, attributes, probabilistic_sampler, span]
          exporters: [jaeger, otlp/jaeger]
          
        # Metrics pipeline
        metrics:
          receivers: [otlp, prometheus, k8s_cluster, hostmetrics]
          processors: [memory_limiter, batch, resource, attributes]
          exporters: [prometheus]
          
        # Logs pipeline
        logs:
          receivers: [otlp]
          processors: [memory_limiter, batch, resource, attributes]
          exporters: [logging]
      
      # Telemetry configuration
      telemetry:
        logs:
          level: info
          initial_fields:
            service: opentelemetry-collector
            version: {{ .Chart.AppVersion }}
        metrics:
          address: 0.0.0.0:8888
          level: detailed
---
# Service Monitor for OpenTelemetry Collector metrics
{{- if .Values.monitoring.prometheus.enabled }}
apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
kind: ServiceMonitor
metadata:
  name: opentelemetry-collector
  namespace: {{ .Values.namespaces.monitoring }}
  labels:
    {{- include "manifolded.labels" . | nindent 4 }}
    app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-servicemonitor
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/component: opentelemetry-collector
  endpoints:
  - port: metrics
    path: /metrics
    interval: 30s
    scrapeTimeout: 10s
{{- end }}
{{- end }}

input.content:
# Manifolded Platform Helm Chart

Enterprise-grade Multi-Dimensional AI Platform with Quantum Computing and Economic Systems

![Version: 1.0.0](https://img.shields.io/badge/Version-1.0.0-informational?style=flat-square)
![Type: application](https://img.shields.io/badge/Type-application-informational?style=flat-square)
![AppVersion: 1.0.0](https://img.shields.io/badge/AppVersion-1.0.0-informational?style=flat-square)

## Overview

Manifolded is a revolutionary platform that transcends traditional AI limitations through multi-dimensional computation spaces, high-performance quantum computing (HPQC), and integrated economic systems. This Helm chart provides production-ready deployment of the complete platform infrastructure.

## Architecture

The platform consists of four main specializations:

- **Quantum Engine**: HPQC-enabled quantum computing with Phoenix NIFs
- **Economic Engine**: High-throughput payment processing with quantum signatures  
- **AI Consciousness**: Multi-LLM autonomous agents with quantum enhancement
- **Phoenix Dashboard**: Real-time web interface with comprehensive monitoring

## Quick Start

### Prerequisites

- Kubernetes 1.24+
- Helm 3.8+
- 16+ CPU cores and 64GB+ RAM recommended
- GPU nodes (optional, for AI Consciousness)
- Persistent storage (100GB+ recommended)

### Basic Installation

```bash
# Add the Manifolded Helm repository
helm repo add manifolded https://helm.manifolded.ai
helm repo update

# Install with default configuration
helm install manifolded manifolded/manifolded

# Install with custom values
helm install manifolded manifolded/manifolded -f my-values.yaml
```

### Production Installation

```bash
# Create dedicated namespaces
kubectl create namespace manifolded-system
kubectl create namespace manifolded-quantum  
kubectl create namespace manifolded-economic
kubectl create namespace manifolded-ai
kubectl create namespace manifolded-integration
kubectl create namespace manifolded-monitoring

# Install with production configuration
helm install manifolded manifolded/manifolded \
  --namespace manifolded-system \
  --set global.environment=production \
  --set security.podSecurityStandards.enforce=restricted \
  --set monitoring.enabled=true \
  --set tracing.enabled=true \
  -f production-values.yaml
```

## Configuration

### Core Platform Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `global.environment` | Deployment environment (dev/staging/production) | `production` |
| `global.domain` | Primary domain for the platform | `manifolded.ai` |
| `global.registry` | Container registry | `ghcr.io` |
| `global.repository` | Repository prefix | `manifolded` |

### Quantum Engine Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `quantumEngine.enabled` | Enable quantum computing engine | `true` |
| `quantumEngine.replicaCount` | Number of quantum engine replicas | `3` |
| `quantumEngine.config.hpqcEnabled` | Enable high-performance quantum computing | `true` |
| `quantumEngine.config.maxQubits` | Maximum qubits supported | `1024` |
| `quantumEngine.config.coherenceTimeMs` | Quantum coherence time in milliseconds | `1000` |
| `quantumEngine.config.errorCorrectionThreshold` | Error correction threshold | `0.001` |

### Economic Engine Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `economicEngine.enabled` | Enable economic processing engine | `true` |
| `economicEngine.replicaCount` | Number of economic engine replicas | `5` |
| `economicEngine.config.targetTps` | Target transactions per second | `10000` |
| `economicEngine.config.latencyTargetMs` | Target latency in milliseconds | `10` |
| `economicEngine.config.quantumSignaturesRequired` | Require quantum signatures | `true` |

### AI Consciousness Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `aiConsciousness.enabled` | Enable AI consciousness system | `true` |
| `aiConsciousness.replicaCount` | Number of AI consciousness replicas | `2` |
| `aiConsciousness.config.maxConcurrentAgents` | Maximum concurrent AI agents | `100` |
| `aiConsciousness.config.safetyConstraintsLevel` | Safety constraints level | `enterprise` |
| `aiConsciousness.gpu.enabled` | Enable GPU acceleration | `true` |

### Security Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `security.enabled` | Enable security hardening | `true` |
| `security.podSecurityStandards.enabled` | Enable Pod Security Standards | `true` |
| `security.podSecurityStandards.enforce` | PSS enforcement level | `restricted` |
| `security.networkPolicies.enabled` | Enable network policies | `true` |
| `security.vault.enabled` | Enable HashiCorp Vault integration | `true` |

### Monitoring and Observability

| Parameter | Description | Default |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| `monitoring.enabled` | Enable monitoring stack | `true` |
| `monitoring.prometheus.enabled` | Enable Prometheus | `true` |
| `monitoring.grafana.enabled` | Enable Grafana | `true` |
| `tracing.enabled` | Enable distributed tracing | `true` |
| `tracing.jaeger.enabled` | Enable Jaeger | `true` |

## Storage Configuration

The platform requires persistent storage for various components:

```yaml
storage:
  storageClass: manifolded-ssd
  quantum:
    size: 50Gi      # Quantum state storage
  economic:  
    size: 200Gi     # Economic transaction storage
  ai:
    models: 100Gi   # AI model storage
    state: 50Gi     # AI agent state storage
  monitoring:
    prometheus: 200Gi  # Metrics storage
    loki: 100Gi        # Logs storage
```

## Environment-Specific Configuration

The chart supports environment-specific overrides:

### Development Environment
```yaml
global:
  environment: dev
environments:
  dev:
    replicaCount: 1
    monitoring:
      enabled: false
    security:
      podSecurityStandards:
        enforce: baseline
```

### Production Environment
```yaml
global:
  environment: production
environments:
  production:
    monitoring:
      enabled: true
    security:
      podSecurityStandards:
        enforce: restricted
    backup:
      enabled: true
      schedule: "0 2 * * *"
      retention: "90d"
```

## Networking

### Ingress Configuration

```yaml
ingress:
  enabled: true
  className: nginx
  annotations:
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-redirect: "true"
    cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: "letsencrypt-prod"
  hosts:
    - host: api.manifolded.ai
      paths:
        - path: /
          pathType: Prefix
          service: phoenix-dashboard
          port: 4000
        - path: /api/v1/quantum
          pathType: Prefix  
          service: quantum-engine
          port: 8080
  tls:
    - secretName: manifolded-tls-secret
      hosts:
        - api.manifolded.ai
```

### Network Policies

The chart includes comprehensive network policies for zero-trust security:

- Default deny-all policy
- Component-specific ingress/egress rules
- Cross-namespace communication controls
- Monitoring and observability access

## Performance Benchmarking

The platform includes comprehensive performance benchmarking tools:

```bash
# Run quantum performance benchmarks
cd benchmarks
cargo run --release --bin quantum_benchmark

# Run integration benchmarks  
python3 integration_benchmark.py

# Run complete benchmark suite
./benchmark_runner.sh --namespace production --verbose
```

### Benchmark Results

Expected performance targets:

| Component | Metric | Target |
|-----------|--------|---------|
| Quantum Engine | Gate operation latency | < 1ms |
| Quantum Engine | Entanglement creation | < 2ms |
| Economic Engine | Transaction throughput | 10,000+ TPS |
| Economic Engine | Payment latency | < 10ms |
| AI Consciousness | Agent response time | < 300ms |
| Phoenix Dashboard | Page load time | < 2s |

## Observability

### Metrics Collection

Prometheus automatically scrapes metrics from all components:

- Application-specific metrics (throughput, latency, errors)
- Infrastructure metrics (CPU, memory, network, storage)
- Quantum computing metrics (coherence time, error rates)
- Economic metrics (transaction volume, signature verification)
- AI metrics (agent performance, model inference time)

### Distributed Tracing

Jaeger and OpenTelemetry provide comprehensive tracing:

- End-to-end request tracing across all components
- Quantum operation tracing with timing analysis
- Economic transaction flow visibility
- AI agent interaction patterns
- Performance bottleneck identification

### Logging

Centralized logging with Loki:

- Structured JSON logging from all components
- Log correlation with traces and metrics
- Security event logging
- Audit trail for compliance

## Security Features

### Pod Security Standards

All components run with restricted Pod Security Standards:

- Non-root containers
- Read-only root filesystems
- No privileged escalation
- Dropped Linux capabilities
- Seccomp profiles enabled

### Network Security

- Zero-trust network policies
- Encrypted inter-component communication
- TLS termination at ingress
- Service mesh (optional)

### Secrets Management

Integration with HashiCorp Vault:

- Dynamic secret generation
- Automatic secret rotation
- Fine-grained access controls
- Audit logging

## High Availability

### Multi-Zone Deployment

```yaml
affinity:
  podAntiAffinity:
    preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
    - weight: 100
      podAffinityTerm:
        topologyKey: topology.kubernetes.io/zone
```

### Auto-scaling

Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) configuration:

```yaml
autoscaling:
  enabled: true
  minReplicas: 3
  maxReplicas: 20
  targetCPU: 70
  targetMemory: 80
  customMetrics:
    - type: Pods
      pods:
        metric:
          name: quantum_operations_per_second
        target:
          type: AverageValue
          averageValue: "1000"
```

## Disaster Recovery

### Backup Strategy

```yaml
backup:
  enabled: true
  schedule: "0 2 * * *"  # Daily at 2 AM
  retention: "90d"
  destinations:
    - s3://manifolded-backups/quantum-state
    - s3://manifolded-backups/economic-data
    - s3://manifolded-backups/ai-models
```

### Multi-Region Deployment

For global deployment with data sovereignty:

```yaml
global:
  regions:
    - name: us-east-1
      primary: true
    - name: eu-west-1
      dataSovereignty: true
    - name: ap-southeast-1
      dataSovereignty: true
```

## Compliance

The platform supports major compliance frameworks:

- **SOC 2 Type II**: Automated controls and audit logging
- **ISO 27001**: Information security management
- **GDPR**: Data privacy and right to be forgotten
- **HIPAA**: Healthcare data protection
- **PCI DSS**: Payment card industry security

### Compliance Configuration

```yaml
security:
  compliance:
    frameworks:
      - soc2_type_ii
      - iso27001  
      - gdpr
      - hipaa
      - pci_dss
    auditLogging: comprehensive
    dataEncryption: required
    accessControls: rbac
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### Pod Startup Issues
```bash
# Check pod status
kubectl get pods -n manifolded-system

# Check events
kubectl get events -n manifolded-system --sort-by=.metadata.creationTimestamp

# Check pod logs
kubectl logs -f deployment/quantum-engine -n manifolded-quantum
```

#### Performance Issues
```bash
# Run performance benchmarks
./benchmarks/benchmark_runner.sh

# Check resource usage
kubectl top pods -n manifolded-system

# Analyze traces
kubectl port-forward -n manifolded-monitoring svc/jaeger-query 16686:16686
```

#### Connectivity Issues
```bash
# Test internal connectivity
kubectl exec -it deployment/phoenix-dashboard -n manifolded-system -- \
  curl http://quantum-engine.manifolded-quantum:8080/health

# Check network policies
kubectl get networkpolicy -A

# Verify DNS resolution
kubectl exec -it deployment/phoenix-dashboard -n manifolded-system -- \
  nslookup quantum-engine.manifolded-quantum.svc.cluster.local
```

### Health Checks

All components provide health check endpoints:

- `/health` - Liveness probe
- `/ready` - Readiness probe  
- `/metrics` - Prometheus metrics

### Support

For production support:

- Documentation: https://docs.manifolded.ai
- Issues: https://github.com/manifolded/platform/issues
- Enterprise Support: support@manifolded.ai
- Community: https://discord.gg/manifolded

## License

This Helm chart is licensed under the AGPL-3.0 License. See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details.

---

**Manifolded**: Transcending the boundaries of traditional AI through multi-dimensional quantum-enhanced computation.
